reviewDescription: I'll start with the negatives.Where your butt goes... it's a bit too firm. After 30 minutes your butt is gonna hurt.  That's the most important part of the chair....The leg rest is okay. It just doesn't extend as far as I'd like. The leg rest also doesn't slide with ease like others I've had.The massager is terrible. Didn't expect it to be good tbh. It just vibrates and hums. 0 effect on your back.  The pillows are fine. But I wouldn't even advertise it as a massager if I was the company.  It's a gimmick.The arm rests are pretty comfortable. The back is fairly comfortable for me. A short person. If you're 5'10" or taller you'll want a different chair.Back and neck pillows are good. I'd almost say you need them for the chair to be somewhat comfortable.Overall it's an uncomfortable chair. It wasn't expensive so I won't say I didn't get my money's worth. I did. It does the job.But the seat is too d*mn firm. Needs some fluff. Consider buying a 2nd cushion to use if you decide to go with this chair.  I waited to see if it'd need a break in period before writing a review.  After 2 months use.  My a** still hurts. 🤣Positives:Neck/Back pillowsArm restsLook/designNegatives:Everything that makes a chair good, ceases to exist.Hard buttShort Back restVibrating pillow gives your back a hummer.If you recline it wants to tip over.The recline isn't a full flat lay down. More like a 45° angle at best.Hope this helps your decision.

reviewTitle: Decent "For The Price," but is showing its cheap quality with normal use after only 3-4 months.
reviewDescription: Overall, this is a decent chair "For the Price."  I have used it on a daily basis at my computer, normal use, no spills, no tears, no accidents of any kind... and after only 3-4 months (May-August) the fake leather is starting to peel and get discolored in the corner of the seat cushion as you can see.  The back cushion is significantly flattened from when I purchased it as well from normal use.  The back of the seat reclines, but the bottom does not lean with it, so it sometimes feels like I am about to slide out of the chair when I recline.  The footrest is chintzey - when I really want a footrest it's better than nothing, but it's not really that comfortable and not convenient to pull out, so I mostly don't use it as a result.All in all, it's a chair, and it works, and if you're on a tight budget - it will work for you too.  If you want a "good quality" chair though and you're willing to spend a little bit extra, I recommend looking elsewhere.

I've had this chair for two years now. When I first purchased this chair I thought it looked nice and it was comfortable. When I was assembling the chair there were some parts of the chair that weren't exactly straight, but it wasn't bad enough to not let me put it together. I wasn't impressed with the quality of the foot rest, but other than that things were okay for a short while. I started having to tighten the arm rest screws monthly because they were loosening greatly. Within a short period of time I noticed the frame of the chair was bending towards the left because I lean to my left. A better made chair would not be doing this or at least not that soon. Also, the cushion padding on the seat was flat and non-existant after 6 months. Now, after only two years, the metal part on the side of the base of the seat where the arm rest screw tightens into completely broke off. Not the screw but the metal part of the chair frame! How does metal break? This product is not worth the investment. This was too much money for me to waste on a chair that was warped after 6 months and completely broken after 2 years.

This thing is a beast. I'm disabled and it was a task just getting it from my porch into my living room.Assembly was easy aside from getting the backrest on. That took far too much effort. It was then that I noticed that the zippers on the backrest were broken. There was no finger tabs to hold onto to use the zippers, so I had to go to the store and buy a repair kit to fix them. No way was I going to take it apart, box it back up, and try to find someone to help me get it to a return spot or to the post office to return it. I'd rather spend the extra 5 bucks and just fix it myself since the manufacturer can't seem to box it up without breaking it.It's a good thing it has a back massager, as I needed it when I was done assembling the chair.Overall, if you don't mind wrenching your back just moving the box and can do some basic self-repair, then go for it. It has good support and the massager is nice.For my own part, I won't be buying a chair from this company ever again, though. I don't like buying broken items.

reviewTitle: Eh, medium quality for its price
reviewDescription: Given how expensive this is, I do not like this at all. The cushion is okay at best, it is NOT sturdy and is continuously requiring me to retighten its bolts, especially for the arm rests even though it was built perfectly right from the get go. It is nice outside material and looks pretty, easy to move on wheels but provides minimal back support as the cushions are not placed properly and the head cushion is actually refusing to stay in place. I would return this if I could but it’s actually pretty heavy and it came in with a box that had fallen apart.

This is a very uncomfortable chair. Probably the most important part of any chair is the the seat and it just feels like there is no padding there, and the support of the back is basically not present. I'd like to say you get what you pay for but I could get a more comfortable chair at walmart for half the price, I paid $100 and this chair, it isnt even worth that. That being said, the chair faux leather is about what you expect and the chair articulation seems to do everything well enough. Since the chair is assembled Im not going to return it, its not worth the effort, I'll save it for a backup chair for guests or what ever. I regret buying this chair, even at a discount. My 10 year old cheap office $40 chair from walmart does a better job.(Im 6ft at 180 lbs)

reviewTitle: Not bad needs significant improvement before I can recommend it.
reviewDescription: Before we get started there’s no instructions YouTube videos are awful. Just don’t. I did find a pdf of instructions for a very similar chair that got me through it. Assembly isn’t hard so let’s get into it.1. MAJOR MALFUNCTION - The armrests are nice but they get loose after a few reclines. I’ve tightened the bolts as much as I dare without damaging the backrest or the screws themselves.2. The leg rest. FLIMSY. If you’re a big guy and saw the 400lb capacity and said “hey that looks great!” You’re gonna be disappointed. It dips down when you put your legs on it. It’s basically unusable.3. Seat, backrest and lumbar support:Not terrible. Lumbar pillow could be firmer and larger. Vibration is a joke. My phone vibrates harder. No seat depth adjustment but it’s not a deal breaker as most gaming chairs don’t offer this. Back rest is comfortable enough that I fell asleep in it. Adjusting the backrest isn’t super easy nor is it sufficiently spring loaded to come back up all the way on its own. The seat is kinda hard but it’s 110$ chair I can’t complain about it too much.4: HARDWARE - gas cylinder, base and wheels: it doesn’t lower smoothly for its purported capacity. You’ll drop like a rock. Wheels are not color coordinated which is a bummer but not a dealbreaker. Universal wheels are 14$ and fit great if you have carpet like I do. Base is also a bland black plastic seems sturdy enough.Over all the loosening armrests are the biggest issue the other chairs on here like Dowinx have a car style lever to adjust the backrest and I think I may go with that unless we can get the armrests to stay put.

When I received the chair, I was missing some parts. Wheels, screws, levers, chair. Contacting customer service and getting them to send replacements was time consuming. UPDATE: Although assembly was relatively easy once I received all the missing parts (actually I was still missing a few screws) after only a few weeks I have had to tighten the arms several times.The seat of the chair is not near as comfy as they say, the footstool is not very useful or sturdy and the back support of the chair is already losing the padding there and is now very uncomfortable. UPDATE: Chair needs more durable padding in all areas. The padding in the seat and back (shoulder area) are already worn and I have had to replace with a pillow to pad the entire back rest. Because of the failing back rest padding I had to remove the lumbar pillow so I could use my own pillow for support and padding.  Also the velco strap holding the neck support pillow is losing strength and that pillow is sagging.Also - not made for short people - I'm 5'3"  and I can only just barely have feet flat on floor and the arms are too short (it'd be nice if they could be adjusted.) Definitely not worth the cost. Look elsewhere for a better a chair.

reviewTitle: Like sitting on those hard benches we had in school.
reviewDescription: It was easy to put together, I'm not sure how study it is tho, my left armrest keeps bending way out. It does recline, assuming you would ever need that feature, and it does go up and down via this hydrologic pole the seat is mounted on, and it does swivel all the way around, which was something I was actually looking for, playing my Oculus. Being able to spin around quickly is definitely an advantage. But holy crap, that thing is NOT at all comfortable to sit on. I would DEFINITELY recommend a pillow or SOMETHING to sit on. I've sat on bleachers that were more comfortable than this thing was. Even with a pillow, it's not going to be your "go to" chair, I can tell you that right now. Honestly I wish I would have gone with something else and I see this particular company makes a lot of gaming chairs but honestly, I'm not sure if I want another one of theirs and now I'm sure WHAT to look for in a gaming chair. I mean it's really not comfortable at all. 😭

reviewTitle: There are much better options out there
reviewDescription: This product was just of very low quality. I put the chair together and knew immediately there was no way. The massage pillow cut in and out constantly, it was being held together by this hot glue stuff that was coming out the end of it. Sitting in the chair wasn’t remotely comfy either. There’s a pocket rocket somewhere in your wife’s nightstand that could offer a better back massage than this thing. Guaranteed. Spend your money elsewhere.

reviewTitle: Decent chair for the price but quality could be a tad better
reviewDescription: This chair is "ok".  I've been in IT for 18 years at the time of this review, owned the chair about 8 months now, but I have certainly sat in a lot of different chairs throughout the years.  I needed this as a quick replacement as I changed jobs and felt the price was good at the time.  I like the lumbar vibration when I need it because I have posture and back issues and that helps me get through the day sometimes.  I also game in this chair at night with my buddies so, I do tend to spend about 12+ hours in this chair a day somedays.  It does tilt back pretty far and has a foot/leg rest.  I've almost went over backwards sometimes depending on how I shift in the chair.  I am a 6ft 180lb male so, nothing too drastic.  I do have to tighten the screws in the arm-rests maybe once a month as they become very loose and wiggle around a lot.  Definitely annoying but, I keep the wrench right by the desk for when I need it.  Overall its a decent chair, for the price.  Would I buy it again? Ehhh....unsure....but its decent. 3/5 stars for me.

In general, this chair sacrifices comfort for aesthetic. A lot of "features" felt cheap and unhelpful, while the chair itself isn't anything to write home about.It's wider than my previous chair which is nice because I am broad shoulderedThe padding on the chair is pretty stiff and not that comfortable, but I'm hoping that will fix itself in time.The reclining features is laughable, it has a tiny little kick stand that doesn't feel very sturdy and the back doesn't recline to a full 180.I bought this chair on sale for 113 bucks and it's a decent chair but I'm a little disappointed. I certainly wouldn't pay full price for it.I'm probably just going to buy a regular office chair next time for the sake of comfort.

I have purchased these disposable office chairs for 30 years now. They all share certain idiosyncrasies. None of them are built straight, with the chair tilting to one side or another. This one is no different. I would like to say that you get what you pay for, but I have purchased chairs for several times this price with the same problems. Can't say I expected much else.I don't know why it seems everyone puts up with these same issues coming from the same factories in the same country with poor quality control, and then give them high ratings, other than, apparently this is all we can get. Just like shoes, if you find a good pair and it wears out, you can rarely get the same one to replace it. So you roll the dice and get what you get. This chair, just like all the other ones I have purchased, deserves three stars, and no more.

I wasn't expecting a lot when I bought this but I will say the quality of the components could be higher. Primarily in the hardware that comes with it. Nearly all of the bolts that go into the arms have since come loose and are now stripped after having to tighten them up multiple times. If you're able, use some lock tite on the screws before installing them. You'll thank me down the road. Overall the chair is fine, comfortable and I'll continue to use it. I just with the construction were higher quality. For $100 though you can't really complain too much I guess. The vibration on the lumbar pillow is kind of fun but isn't something I use often. The manufacturer could have saved some money on the vibration component and spent more on hardware.

This chair I’ve used for almost a year now. The chair has some nice features like the extendable leg rest and the ability to recline as well as wheels to move it around a room. It is also relatively sturdy. The chair does squeak after some use so additional tightening of the bolts and screws are needed. The pillows they provide are pretty much useless especially the “lumbar” pillow that is supposed to support your lower back. I’ve had to throw it away and buy an actual lumbar support pad because the pillows are really useless. Without the pillows the back of the chair is just a hard board. Other than that it’s a alright chair for the price.

The chair is somewhat comfy but not if you have to stay in it for hours at a time. After a couple months of use, the leather of the arms of the chair are already cracking and peeling. On the right arm, I have to tighten the Allen screw what feels like every other week.

reviewTitle: Not labeled and what is labeled was not labeled correctly
reviewDescription: The chair is great once put together however most pieces were not labeled. The ones that were label they were not correct. For example in the book, an Allen Wrench was labeled R. The item labeled R in the box was the arm of the chair.

Looks great went together easy. Foot rest was shorter that expected. I’m 5’6” and it rests on the back of my calves. The screws in the arm rest loosen over time so maybe add a washer on both ends and throw some loctite in there.

reviewTitle: It was good but not that good
reviewDescription: It’s a really nice chair and really easy to put together and really helps with your back but hurts my butt and the leg rest is really small and doesn’t go out that far but it’s a decent chair I would say !

Easy to esaamble, good price. After 6 months of purchase, it has been noticed of low quality, you have to tighten the screws every week, the chair sounds a lot as if it were very poorly assembled, that’s why 3 stars

This is meant for anyone over 63 inches in height. You will find this otherwise uncomfortable to sit on for an extended period of time or simply limited in locomotion. You’ll find yourself fastening the arm chair bolts ever so often. The material seems to be holding for now.

Sitting in the chair for an hour or so hurts my lower back. The chair isn’t really comfortable and I had to add better supports to it. The lumbar support that came with it didn’t hold its cushion more than a few weeks of only sitting an hour or so a day in the chair. The chair looks really nice, but I’d rather have something comfortable. You definitely get what you pay for, and that’s why this chair is so cheap.

It's a fine chair and my biggest complaint is the arm rests. They're connected to the base of the chair and the back of the chair so the height of the arm rest isn’t adjustable so my arms just hover above them which is uncomfortable. I'm 5'3 so I'm assuming if you're taller your arms will be longer so it might not be a problem. The arms also feel like they're connected very weakly to the chair(although I tightened its bolts as tight as I could) and feel like when I leaned to the side to reach the pedals under the chair it would eventually snap the arm rest off. (Those pedals under the chair are also very hard to reach which caused extra leaning on the arm rest)For the leg rest, I like sitting criss cross so I was excited for this to give me a bit of extra space but when i tried it, it didnt feel very sturdy or durable. I'm worried that if I put the full weight of my legs down on it it'll break. It also doesn't give you the option to rock the chair back other than actually using the pedals to adjust the seat back.Not the worst chair but not the best, I'd rather spend an extra bit of cash on a better quality chair.

reviewTitle: Missing screw for the back rest plate
reviewDescription: There is a metal plate that connects the seat and back rest. Based on the instruction. That plate is screwed by an M6x30 screw (4). The threading isn’t M6. It’s an M8 threading (the hole is bigger).  There are 4 M8x40 screws but they are used for the arm rest. I did manage to go to Home Depot and got the right size screw. Just more an inconvenience

5'4", 110lbs tween has used this for a year and has been unable to configure it for comfort (removed the extra support pillows, put them back, recline & adjustments, etc.) . After a mere 60 minutes or so of sitting his back would hurt. He might be too small for it ATM, however the chair is also too small for a 5'11" adult.On the plus side he was able to resell it at a similar price as purchased (minus shipping cost).I recommend avoiding gimmicky "gaming chairs" and getting something with long lasting comfort - a quality office chair...without "massagers", ill-placed lumbar or foot supports, etc.

reviewTitle: Cheap for not so cheap a price.
reviewDescription: Assembly: I had to force one arm into place to be able to get the bolt in, literally bending it into place.Support: The bottom is very thick and comfortable but the the spring is extremely weak and not adjustable. So leaning back with just the slightest pressure sends you all the way back.First time with a chair like this so for those in the same situation, the lumbar pad is far to large so you either don't touch the back of the chair with it or your back is bent far out of shape not like proper lumbar support. And the vibrator (not massager) is easily muffled if you really lean back on it and it generates heat after more then a few minutes of use. Oh and its only got a USB power supply.Spend a little bit more and get a proper office chair, especially for gaming, this is a joke and I'm sure all the rest are just as bad.

reviewTitle: Bad cushioning, useless footrest, poor fittings.
reviewDescription: Easy to assemble but I don't expect much durability. Some of the bolts and fittings were poorly machined, couldn't get some fully tightened and ended up causing slipping with the hex. The arms already have some give to them.The footrest is terrible. It's just two metal rods that slide into a plastic base beneath the seat. The amount of sag makes it uncomfortable to use and the short length lands just about mid-calf on me. I am not a long legged man, so it would definitely be worse on others.Lastly, the back support has almost no cushion. I can feel the support bar against my spine. The included pillows aren't bad and can make up for it if you get them positioned just right. The seat has more cushion, but still more firm than I prefer. I end up having to shift every 5 or 10 minutes to get back comfortable.I'll keep it for the hassle and the price, but certainly not the cushy desk chair I was hoping for.

I am writing this review after owning this chair just a little over a year. The materials are poor quality. There's minimal  padding inside the seat cushion.  The  leather on the chair began to peel off.  The chair will not stay up, go's  down after sitting on it for 10 minutes, I'm only 150 pound.  The chair is not worth the price.The materials used to manufacture this chair is of poor quality.  Don't waste your money.

Overall, this gaming chair is pretty solid. Easy to assemble and pretty sturdy. I like the flexibility it offers as well as the nice padding. However, I ordered the white version and there were little specs of black spots mixed in with the white design which did bother me a bit so be aware of that. I got it on sale so it was not a bad choice at all.EDIT: Chair stains super easily which is extremely disappointing. All I did was place a dry shirt on it and now parts of the chair are the same color as the shirt and it won't come off

reviewTitle: Esta silla no vale el precio que tiene
reviewDescription: Hola la Silla de Juego no tiene la calidad esperada por el dinero que pague,a los tres dias se rompio el masajeador y me mandaron uno nuevo,pero ese tambien se rompio el mismo dia,ahora el amortiguador de la silla se baja solo esto es una estafa,quiero que me la cambien o me devuelvan mi dinero,tambien las ruedas son de muy mala calidad,peso 90kg y casi no ruedan,esta silla es de 60$ no de 170$.gracias

I get the chair, first thing I do is look for the safety standards that's usually under the seat of the chair.  Nothing. I check the pump, also nothing ok. So possibly an exploding chair. Hopefully not but ok, I go to start assembly. Oh hey it's missing the entire base. I double check the boxes, nothing. I have wheels but nothing to put them into. I try to find the number to call in the instructions. It's a website. Ok, I check online, find a number, almost immediately puts me to voice mail because of a high call volume reason. The answering machine is full. What is happening right now? Is this chair going to explode?
Lever is too high up not allowing the foot rest to go in properly.In addition the delivery guy toss the box on top of my garden damaging the flowers.One of the parts for the lever is bent

This product came with multiple scuffed, warped, and broken parts. Also could not even attach one of the arms as the ball bearing inside is crooked and not assembled correctly. Not a great Christmas gift for my finacé overall

Purchased this chair back in july. Ive been tightening screws on the arms again and again as they dont stay tight. The chair its self has broken around the part where the actual chair mounts on the piston and so now it always sits reclined and uneven. Couldn't Recommend.

one of the reasons i bought this was because my main hobby is gaming and i need proper support for my posture and spine, which this does very, very well. the more important reason i spent over $100.00 on a gaming chair is because i am someone who suffers from chronic pain and i need something that doesn't make that pain worse. this chair helps a lot with my lumbar pain, but the actual seat where you sit? my ass hurts after fifteen minutes. there's basically zero cushion for your actual ass. i don't recommend this chair for someone who wants to be fully comfortable unless your have a spare cushion, which you should not need. i regret spending the money i did on this.

reviewTitle: Great, but I can't screw in the right arm rest
reviewDescription: The chair I was sent has a defective right arm. It cannot be screwed into the seat because the plastic inside the arm is crooked, so I had to do a bit of cutting through and super gluing to get it to fit. I have also had to re-screw everything almost every week because of how much movement it requires to disassemble. Despite these flaws, the chair is quite comfortable, and I have been using it for about a year.
Meant more for a kid then an adult
Arms wobble and feel flimsy since day one. Tilt lock barely lasted a month, chair will lean back with barely any pressure so I could never actually rest back against the chair.
Seat mechanism welds broke after about 2 months of use and parts are almost as much as the chair itself

reviewTitle: We can’t tell if the chair is good until we have all parts
reviewDescription: Chair is nice but unusable due to missing arm rests. I can not tell if we like it or not. Customer service is slow

If you’re like me you probably spend hours sifting through reviews before making a purchase online.  Reviews for this chair are pretty high, and for good reason.However I did come across some criticism reviews, and I’m not going to say that others’ experience with this chair aren’t valid.  The main complaint that stuck out was screws loosening over time.  The assembly manual that comes with the chair clearly states that this will happen, and you may need to tighten them.  The reclining feature means that parts have to move and rotate, so this really shouldn’t come as a surprise.  Another complaint I saw was that the footrest wasn’t very sturdy…well, it’s a footrest and not meant to be sat on.  The chair is sturdy, no creaking or popping of parts.  The casters are smooth on carpet, short carpet, which is great. The padding on the seat is comfortable, but I would say it could use a little more on the seat side panels, and could be firmer on the armrests.  All-in-all I’m pretty happy with it thus far.*I’m only 5’7” and 200lbs, it feels like it could handle way more but I personally can’t verify that.

⭐️⚫️🔴 **Fantastic Gaming Chair Experience!** 🔴⚫️⭐️I was pleasantly surprised by the outstanding quality of this red and black gaming chair when I made the purchase on Amazon. The package was impressively heavy, hinting at the sturdiness and durability of the chair within.The assembly process was a breeze thanks to the clear and organized instructions provided. The neatly organized tools, complete with extras, made the setup even more straightforward. What was even more delightful was having my 10-year-old son join in on the assembly process – it turned into a fun and engaging activity for both of us.The moment my son settled into the chair, it was clear that he absolutely loved it! Not only did he find it comfortable, but he was so relaxed that he ended up falling asleep while watching TV. The chair's design and ergonomic features contribute to its comfort, making it a hit with the whole family.The superior quality, comfort, and ease of assembly make this red and black gaming chair a standout purchase. If I ever need another gaming chair in the future, I wouldn't hesitate to buy this one again.Thank you for providing such a fantastic purchase experience and the comfortable end result. This gaming chair has truly exceeded my expectations and brought joy to my son!

reviewTitle: Good for sitting for a long time
reviewDescription: My kid was doing online school and he needed a new chair. I saw that this had a massager and wanted to give it a try. He loves his chair and his back isn't hurting from sitting for a long time.Pros-Foot rest is nice. It's at a good height-The wheels are smooth and glide in our tile floor-Good range of motion-It comes with a USB massager. My kid uses a power bank to power it and it works really well-It has good support in the back and bottom areasCons-Takes a while to put together. You will need tools if you want it to be done right-Heavy. I had a hard time getting this in the door the box was huge and heavy.

reviewTitle: Solid chair, custome support was very helpful.
reviewDescription: I initially ordered the blue chair, but received the black chair instead. Customer support contacted before it arrived and advised I cancel the order, but I missed the email. They offered for me to keep the black chair in exchange for some money back and less hassle on my end, but I declined. They then helped to facilitate returning the incorrect chair and sent the correct one. It took a bit longer than I would have liked, but I was willing to wait. Overall, customer service was very helpful.The chair itself is easy to set up and comfortable. I was worried about it not matching my set up, but it fits fine and is easy to maneuver and adjust.

Got this for my husband and he loves it. The red color is striking and cool looking. The foot rest, arm rest, head rest, and back rest make this chair super comfortable. He did say if you're tall (he's 6'2), the adjustable head rest doesn't fit well. It reclines pretty far back; combined with the extendable foot rest makes it like sitting in a comfy recliner. And it has a built in back massage setting via USB power cord. I can't speak to durability because we have only had it 1 day but the materials seem sturdy and of well quality. Assembly took my husband about an hour.
Stylish and very comfy compared to a regular computer chair. Easy to set up as well.

Bought as a request for my son for his birthday.  He choose the fabric so it would not be to hot/cold. Material is made well, small touches like the padding on the arms and the neck and massaging lumbar pillow, and the leg extension which hides away if you don't want to use it are all a bonus. It reclines and licks into place and is easy to operate. The chair was simple to put together.  They thoughtfully included extra parts and an awesome allen wrench. He loves it so much he suggested to his older brother to get one for his birthday.

Chair assembles fairly easy. These things normally take my husband a long time to put together no matter how easy they promise to be, but he got it figured out within an hour or two. The chair is super comfortable to sit in for a long time. It can recline back so far! And you can lock in your preferred amount of recline. The foot rest is awesome, as I'm the kind of person who likes to slouch with my feet propped. I am very happy with this purchase.

Bought this chair for my boyfriend and he loves it ! He has had it for about 2 months and has had no problems he says it is very comfortable! It leans back super far and it even has a foot rest and comes with a back piece that vibrates as a massager ! Very good quality for the price !

I have been using it for few days in a row now and it is still good and comfortable to sit in. I have sciatica inflammation/nerve issues on one side, having the lumbar massage come with the chair with the chair adjusted at right height and back support, the whole thing did the job good by making me sit comfortable and relax the muscles in my bad spot (lumbar & pelvis). I am currently sitting in it as I type this. I will highly recommend this even for office, not just for gaming.

reviewTitle: Good for price, but quality is iffy.
reviewDescription: The quality of material could be better. I gifted it to my brother for Christmas and for the time he's had it, it's held up but is already starting to wear down a bit in the places he sits/and or uses the most. Good for price though, and I got it while on sale so that was a plus!

reviewTitle: Its alright, Not comfy but ALRIGHT.
reviewDescription: So I got the Red one, And I enjoy the massage feature but I will say overall the chair is super uncomfortable when trying to lay back in it. I did fall once because I leaned back too far and the chair basically fell back. It was kinda funny. The seat doesn't have memory foam which is good, But the back rest is just way too uncomfortable for my back personally. I also have scoliosis and the chair I had before was terrible. For Gaming wise, I'd give this chair a 2 or 3. For Office Work and working from home. Depending on your schedule if you're sitting in it for 4-5 hours straight, Look else where.

reviewTitle: Good quality chair, but missing items
reviewDescription: I like this chair overall, and the most important parts did arrive in good condition. However, it was missing the plastic height adjustment piece that goes between the chair and the base. I can only sit at one height. I requested that piece be sent to me. Other than that, it's a pretty decent chair for the price.
the back rest screws are too long to where they touch your back and you can feel them through the cushion. the chair itself is getting uncomfortable

I bought this because it had tone of great reviews and high star rating but was very disappointed after assembly. The chair itself looks nice, but it’s highly uncomfortable. It is stiff and unforgiving. It makes your butt go numb and isn’t good for long hours. The foot rest is more a calf rest and feels awkward. The massager only works if plugged in to USB but the chord is so short it’s impractical. The material itself feels cheap and I don’t foresee it lasting long. The last zinger is I bought this with Prime thinking I could return it if I didn’t like it - which I can - for the cost of return shipping which is about as much as the chair. Overall, don’t buy this chair. Get a lazyboy from Office Depot.
But as comfortable as I thought it would be plus regret getting those colors.  Should have gotten solid black.
The chair does not rock.  It's either all or nothing with this chair back.  Not supportive enough.

I gave it three stars because at least it resembles a chair when it is assembled. But it is the most uncomfortable, poor quality chair I have ever seen I do not recommend anyone buy this chair. I have used it for a total of two hours and have bad tailbone pain. Once again I do not recommend this for anyone wanting to sit for more than 5 minutes… would return it if I didn’t have to disassemble it….

Ordered all gray, but received black and gray. Although it was shipped with the wrong color, this chair is comfortable. I did notice that this chair doesn’t recline as much as my bf’s gt player chair, all leather, but enough to feel comfortable. The massage feature is ok as well. I didn’t care much for that feature but if you don’t mind being sent the wrong color, I’d say this chair is pretty decent.

reviewTitle: It’s nice but you get what you pay for.
reviewDescription: I have had this chair for a few months now and used it 6-10 hrs M-F.Pro: looks good. Comfortable for 4-5 hours at a time. Cheap. Kids love the slide out foot rest. Little lumbar pillow really works!CON: Cushion starts to give out after a month. Chair screws for the arm rest loosen over time, you have to tighten them up once a month.Conclusion - I like the chair but I’m worried about the cushion becoming a total pancake in a few more months.  It’s only about 1 inch thick. An extra inch would make this chair 4.5 stars.
I was on budget but I would get more comfy because I spent a lot of time on games. for an hour a day its okey but not more than hour I think
Overall quality of the chair seems quite high. The only issues I have are the narrow back and lack of good lumbar support. As someone with back problems it isn’t ideal but I still like the chair.

The chair is good and functional for the cost however it is quite uncomfortable especially in the back. If you are a very slim individual it should be fine but the back juts in at an uncomfortable angle. If you want something cheaper its a solid choice but not for sitting in for long time periods.

I bought this chair for my son for Christmas, and when i opened it to assemble, it was missing all the hardware. The chair itself looks like it's going to be a decent gaming chair if i can get the hardware

Love the look, but very hard and not comfortable. Top neck pad just doesn't fit right, always moving around. Arm covers started wearing after 2 months. Lumbar pad always moves, too. Of it had a better butt pad and thicker arm rest covers I would give it a 4 of 5 stars. Neck pad is just a plain stupid design.

Well when I opened the door and seen the box it looked like it was on the front lines fighting in Ukraine for the last six months. I had a feeling it wasn't going to need medical attention on the inside. There is a rip on one of the edges and two of the bolt locations that hold the right side armrest were bent so the back is not square. I tried everything to square it up but nothing worked. Trying to line up the bolts was a mission. After doing some triage I got it all together. Once this chair finally gives out which probably won't be long I will just drive down to Office Depot and get a new one. Don't be lazy like I was just drive down the street and buy one local. I'm just counting the days before this thing has a flashback and falls apart.

reviewTitle: hardware breaks, but chair is really nice
reviewDescription: the screw has broke in two in less than 2 weeks. sad this happened, but other then that it was just the chair my grand son wanted.

The product itself is good. Seems of good quality and looks really good. The shipping cost $29.99. Eh..OK whatever. But then..it sat at the warehouse and showed as shippped when it fact it didn't get shipped until 2 days before I got it. Ordered on 7/6/23 and didn't get it until 7/12/23. That part is on the seller. Then FedEx decided to get lazy and deliver it to the leasing office rather than the door. I had to carry the thing, heavy but not crazy heavy, 2 blocks to my apartment. That part is absurd. That is only reason for the lower rating. Other than that, it seems to be pretty decent.

reviewTitle: not near as good as i expected for the price
reviewDescription: total assembly time about 35-40 min, looks great. seat cushons are not near as thick or supportive as i thought they would be, foot rest arms are quite flimsy considering this is supposed to be a chair rated for 300lbs. im 180. its ok at best. I do like the usb powered massage pillow, i like the recline feature although when locked the arm to release is is out of my reach. NOT worth the price in my opinion. spend the extra money (even if double) and get a real gaming chair. i prob would have been happier with a similar priced chair from walmart or office depot.

reviewTitle: If you follow their instruction how to assemble it - u will get lost
reviewDescription: So apparently they are using same instructions for the different chairs they have manufactured before.Some things are drawn differently, the sizes of screws, bolts, etc. do not match, I had to choose the details at random. It took 3 hours to assemble. The right handle is constantly falling and it is impossible to screw it down

I have only had this chair for a day and I haven’t felt this kind of support since my mother carried me in her womb. I’m 6’3, 230lbs and back support is so important since I work from home. The chair may tip a little if I’m not careful when I lean too far all the way back but other than that it’s fantastic. The massage feature and seat cushion are amazing. I think it’s shines best when just sitting upright with all the back and neck support.
My son loves this chair. No issues putting it together. Would recommend.

I got this chair for my son and as I was putting it together I noticed the gas lift was missing. I contacted the seller and got a response from them within a couple hours. They got me the gas lift and let me just say I find myself sitting in the chair often. So comfortable.

Brought this for my boyfriend gaming setup! Was a bit tendinous putting it together; he did not add on the footrest piece... personally I would've added it, but it was his gift, so I let him be. He's 5'9 around 275lbs and the chair held him great. Only had the chair for seven months and the chair started to lean a bit, when I noticed I immediately contacted the seller and they quickly determined the problem with pictures and sent out the correct piece to fix the problem.
it’s a very perfect gaming chair, a little stiff but i’m sure after a month it’s gonna be softer from me sitting on it. was very easy to assemble. 10/10.
Durable, comfortable & sleek! GREAT value
comfortable, nice movement

Great gaming chair! My husband is 6"2' and finds this chair extremely comfortable for gaming and PC use. He doesn't really use the vibrating pillow. He really appreciates the adjustability of the back rest and leg rest. Assembly was very easy and the size is perfect for him. Very good back support.
Super comfy
This is good quality and easy to put together…got it 50% off during the sale !

reviewTitle: Okay chair for an okay price.
reviewDescription: Armrests move forward and back with the reclining, do not adjust up or down. The chair and parts do not feel cheap or like it won't last long but the seat is thin and gets harder over time. The foot rest is small, angles kind of like a barber's chair and will probably be under your calves or ankles. Better fits someone closer to 5'6 more comfortably than someone closer to 6'. The reclining feature has a lock to set where you want it. The bottom back pad has a vibrating feature which while not like a massage chair, feels nice to use. Too many gaming/computer chairs are way overpriced; for what you get, this chair is an okay purchase. May not fit larger legs or waist, (I'm 230lbs, 250lbs would be the upper limit for seat space between arm rests). On the stiff side, but with back and head cushion. Decent start chair.
I feel this product is highly over-rated and is definitely not comfortable for the price

reviewTitle: Seat not cushioned enough. Otherwise, a solid chair.
reviewDescription: Great in every other way but the seat does not have enough cushion. Have to buy an additional seat cushion or else it becomes very uncomfortable after an hour or so.This reclines more than expected. Great feature.The foot rest could come out a little farther. Sits high in the calf if you’re over 5’11’’.

reviewTitle: Mixed Feelings About the GTPLAYER Gaming Chair
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the GTPLAYER Gaming Chair in white for my son, hoping to provide him with a comfortable gaming and study spot. While the chair has some positives, there are a couple of notable drawbacks that have left us with mixed feelings.Pros:1. **Stylish Appearance**: The white color of this gaming chair gives it a modern and sleek look that fits well in his gaming setup.2. **Lumbar Support and Headrest**: The inclusion of lumbar support and a headrest provides additional comfort during extended gaming or study sessions.3. **Footrest**: The footrest is a nice addition, allowing him to stretch out and relax between gaming sessions.Cons:1. **Limited Reclining**: One major drawback is that the chair doesn't recline all the way, which my son found disappointing. He was hoping for a more extensive range of reclining options for maximum comfort.2. **Non-Adjustable Armrests**: Another notable issue is that the armrests are not adjustable in height. This lack of flexibility can lead to discomfort during long gaming sessions.In conclusion, the GTPLAYER Gaming Chair in white has a stylish appearance and provides some essential features like lumbar support, a headrest, and a footrest. However, the limited recline and non-adjustable armrests have left my son somewhat dissatisfied. While it may suit some users, those who prioritize extensive recline options and adjustable armrests might want to explore other gaming chair options.
This chair looks great but it's very cheap for the price. When sitting in it you can tell it's a cheap chair. No support and it makes a lot of noise because the swivel really isn't that well made.

Honestly I really liked the chair and how customizable along with being comfortable.But I've had it since last August (so not even a full year.) and where the piston is, the welding split, and looking further into it it barely looked welded. Also another thing that bugged me was the back rest screws are too long to where they barely touch your back but you can feel them through the cushion. The screws are an easy fix, but the welding is another issue. But within the time ive had it, Other than that I'd probably recommend the chair for someone of lighter build than me.

reviewTitle: HARD!!! this is a hard chair not soft. I couldn't sit in this  hair very long.
reviewDescription: Way to hard/firm or a chair. Not for me. The back part of the chair is cheap and flimsy. I would  never suggest this chair for anyone to buy.

I found this dead roach inside of the box with the wheels and pieces I also killed 2 live ones crawling out the box, now I’m gonna have to spray or something to make sure I didn’t miss any since the box had been sitting for a good 20 minutes inside my home. Now the product is good I have no issue with that I do have an issue with roaches inside of the boxes being shipped to me.
Isn't going to last long. Armrests are cracking. Chair creaks and squeaks. Will not roll on carpet.

Easy to put together but the back of the chair was already torn And the plastic it came in was not so it must of happen before shipping it. Still a decent looking chair, going to take it to work to try out, I sure hope it’s better to sit on for long periods at a time. I will up date later

After this I will never purchase furniture from Amazon ever again. Here are the Pros and cons.Pros: Looks really nice and is very easy to put togetherCons: Not comfortable, the reclining foot rest is just horrible! Definitely need to put just amount umph to pull it out, if you yank to hard it comes right off. Then resting your legs on it just feels as if its going to break off. I am no stretch a big person either, then trying push it back in just a jank process. The lumbar and head rest are just strap ons you can place onto any other chair. I bought this chair thinking it would replace my old office chair i purchased from office depot over 20 years ago. Sad to say this was just a poor purchase from my point of view. Hard lesson learned on my part.

reviewTitle: Screws holding the arms continuously loosen
reviewDescription: I’m forever having to re-tighten the screws on the right side arm rest, meanwhile the left side snapped completely. I don’t know what to do at this point except throw it out and buy another new one

reviewTitle: Chair is small NOT for an adult.  Quality is very poor!!
reviewDescription: Chair is not very comfortable for a 6' adult.  The quality is very poor.  I already had to tighten the bolts.  It is nothing special for the price.  I would not purchase again.  Shipping was expensive $29.00 USD.  Picture is deceiving looks much larger than actually is.  NOT GOOD FOR OFFICE CHAIR!

reviewTitle: Be sure to test the screws before assembly!
reviewDescription: I’d highly suggest you save yourself some time and test the threads before full assembly.  My chair has a permanently loose arm as the threads to attach it were damaged. Upon contacting the company there was little they could do for me and requested I send video proof, to an email address outside of Amazon.The comfort is expected for the price. If you’re going to be sitting for long periods you’ll want something more than this. It is hard and rigid with very little padding. It does not feel sturdy, especially the foot rest.

Pros & Cons listed at bottom if you don't want to read all this.I received this chair yesterday. Packing was fine, and assembly was pretty straightforward. The chair looks decent, and is moderately comfortable.It was designed with very cheap plastic, and without much quality. A lot of the plastic pieces had nicks, scratches, and even a couple gouges out of the plastic, which is so soft you can tear into with your fingernail. The pleather is not good for long sitting, as it can cause sweating. I work from home 8 hours a day and typically can spend up to another 5 hours per day on top of that at the computer. It is not comfortable enough for that kind of use. Also, I'm a fairly wide shouldered man, and the "wings" on the side of the chair curve inward, so I feel squeezed rather that supported.The armrests are also very fragile. They're bending armrests and they're only connected at two points to accommodate that, but that also makes them very weak to any kind of sideways pressure.The back without the lumbar pillow is almost comfortable, but has a weird knot about halfway up that sticks into the back. This isn't as noticeable with the lumbar pillow, but that pillow is very uncomfortable, probably because of the mechanisms inside for the massage function. I did not try the massage function.Without the lumbar pillow, it's not bad when reclined with the leg rest, though the leg rest is only held in place by a single screw to prevent the bar from sliding out. I doubt that would work very well for long. However, you have to manually bring the back up after reclining. Not a huge deal, but another annoyance on the long list.Pros:+Fairly comfortable without lumbar pillow/massager.+Nice when reclined+Looks nice+Not terribly priced+Leg rest comfortable+Easy to assemble+Well packaged for shippingCons:-Cheap Material-Uncomfortable with lumbar pillow/massager-Narrow Shoulder "wings"-Flimsy armrests-Material doesn't breath/Makes you sweaty-Plastic came damaged, can be scratched away with fingernail.-Head Pillow strap not adjustable, annoying for tall people-Not comfortable for long work/gaming sessions.-Back of chair does not come back up automatically (have to pull it up)Recommendation:Do not buy this chair. Save your money for a better one. I am going to try for a refund.
Chair seemed nice at first but it didn’t last long only a few months and it broke and isn’t fixable. I’d recommend getting a higher quality chair.

reviewTitle: You get what you pay for....
reviewDescription: So, before you start accusing me here, I am not a sweaty gamer or even a potato of a human that is living in this chair watching netflix. This thing is just cheap, price wise and material wise, I have had this now under 6 months an the "leather" coating is flaking off. The back support is non existent, so spend a bit more money and buy a chair once instead of finding yourself browsing around to replace this one.

Maybe I just got a bad one but I found this chair way too stiff. The extra bells and whistles (lumbar support, footrest) don't really make up for how uncomfortable it is to sit on - especially for someone like me who uses it for 12+ hours a day on workdays. I wound up getting an entirely different chair after a little over a week and love my new one.
Instructions were simple and the chairs comfortable, but unfortunately, they failed to include the footrest.

reviewTitle: Fake leather for arms and seat, cracks and peels less than a year after buying it
reviewDescription: I don't normally write reviews. It's been about a year since I bought this chair. I am really disappointed. It is a comfortable chair, but the fake leather on the arms and seat have been cracking and peeling for a many months now. I expected it to last longer than this. I am 5'9" and 165 lbs. I also take care of the things I own, especially things that cost this much. The cracking and peeling came about just by daily use and it should really last longer than this. Other than this the chair is very nice though.

reviewTitle: Sorting through the return process was......a process
reviewDescription: I have been trying to return this garbage chair since we got it two months ago. Seller gave me the run around for a couple weeks until I filed a claim with Amazon. The seller was then supposed to provide a return label, which they have failed to do and I can't seem to get a competent amazon rep on the phone to help me with the claim. We are currently storing an unusable chair in an enormous box (that we boxed up when they said they'd be sending a return label.....which never came).Key points: Chair arrived with a faulty armrest that could not be screwed in. Seller would not accept the return, amazon has been extremely unhelpful as well. We're out $130. Don't buy from this sellerUpdate 12/9/23: after many phone calls with Amazon we finally got them to issue a return for the chair. Took quite a while and literal hours on the phone trying to get someone competent to help but finally got the return label and shipped the chair back for a refund.
The footrest gets jammed.
Very stiff seat cushion, didn't realize that there is no tilt in the seat, but the recline ability is nice.Leg rest is just for looks unless you are very short.Overall, not a bad chair for the price.

The chair itself is sturdy and supportive. Easy Assembly and everything you need is in the box. Color and feel is good. It does vibrate well and feels good on the lower back.The footrest is shaky at best  definitely needs more support and only extends out to my calves. I'm short so I can only imagine being tall and having to use the footrest. The headrest pillow has already came apart. The zipper didn't last one week. Just going to find another one for now. For $100 it's fair but definitely going to get a better one down the road.
It's certainly sturdy and easy to maneuver.  But your bum aches after a few hours in it.  I just bought an ergonomic chair cushion and I'm much happier.

reviewTitle: Good but can’t use foot rest.
reviewDescription: I was able to put the chair together quick and easy. But I am unable to use the foot rest due to the fact someone forgot to finish drilling the hole all the way and forgot to put the nut in so it will stay screwed in.I need a chair so I am keeping it because the rest of the chair is functional and I really like it. Just disappointed.

It nice chair easy put together. I wouldn’t by this unless you looking cheaper but looks nicer. Materials are kinda cheap. It’s nice for casual use but if you either work from home or play video games pretty regularly this would be a good match. The “skin” of the chair tears pretty easy and the seat becomes uncomfortable after a couple months or so. Other than that it a “decent chair”

After using this chair for a while, it began emitting strange noises that were quite unexpected. Initially, it seemed sturdy and reliable, but these sounds have raised concerns about its long-term durability. The noise occurs mostly when shifting weight or moving, indicating possible issues with the chair's construction or materials. Despite this drawback, the chair remains comfortable and visually appealing. It's disappointing, though, that the quality doesn't seem to match the aesthetic and initial impression.

reviewTitle: Pad is Stiff, Leg Rest is A++
reviewDescription: Comfortable chair for first two hours. After that time line it starts to get very uncomfortable very quickly. However, the leg rest and simple reclining features allow for some alleviation of personal stiffness (pulled those words from Webster lol). Overall, great cheap chair. Worth the buy for casual gamers. If you will be sitting for long periods of time I would invest in a more ergonomic chair.
Support not to great, stability not to great. It was easy to assemble, not versatile

Is everything from Amazon made in China? Chair looks decent but the arm rest constantly is coming loose, the neck rest pillow strap has stretched out so much it hangs below your neck, & it's now starting to lean to one side. This after less than 30 days since purchasing
Easy assembly the quality could be better and after getting it together I found out the back massager wasn’t working and the lumbar pillow zipper missing a piece

reviewTitle: Massage pillow cords broke in less then a week
reviewDescription: I was so excited to get this chair for my desk, I have always wanted one of these. Originally when I bought it I was interested in seeing how the massager worked on my back since I am a swimmer who struggles with back pain a day to day basis from my bacterial meningitis since I was little. it was all going great. Loved how the chair felt for the first 2 days. Today my light weight cat jumped on the chair and the cord from the massager pillow broke. As you can see in the picture I did take it apart to show the pieces. overall was not happy that this was so easy to break. I do not want to return the whole chair because it is very comfortable but seeing the pillow break in 2 days was very disappointing. I would not recommend wasting your money if you plan on the massager being a big part of your decision

I purchased this for my boyfriend’s birthday. He loved it at first, though I sat in it and didn't think it was very comfortable, the padding is thin and firm. After about 2.5 months of daily use, the right arm completely snapped when he rested his arm on it. Definitely not built for grown men or daily use.

The seat has very little cushion (it's kind of deceptive looking imo) especially the bottom and the plastic feels cheap. The massage pillow is a joke, as you could assume. It just vibrates, loudly. I'm very disappointed in myself for purchasing this.

supports in the back seem to be made of plastic and broke after about 2 or 3 weeks of use.screws seem to be ok quality I have been tightening them every few weeks like it said to do and they seem to be holding up so I think that is the only part that is ok quality wise. The leather is very bad quality started peeling only after 2 weeks or so. long story short, ok screws, bad leather, broken supports in the back.And if punctuation is bad I'm young.
Sits ok. Not very comfortable,  padding is thin. Material is cheap and shows wear after only a few months of use. Good for a quick solution,  not a quality product for long term.

reviewTitle: Nice looking, seems made for smaller bodies
reviewDescription: The chair is attractive and has lots of options. It was easy to assemble and all the pieces arrived in good condition. Delivery time was a little long (but that could be the Xmas rush and/or Covid.)As I am working from home I needed a chair that would offer support for an extended period of time.  I considered this as it had a high back. However I would say the chair is not for an adult. I'm 5'7 and found issues with the chair.  If you have wide shoulders the upper side bolsters push in making it hard on your shoulders. The bottom bolsters are okay, but are small bumps. I would rather they be wider or not there at all. Next the cushion is not soft. It is quite firm. I'm 190 and found it too hard and probably too thin. The arm rests are too low for an adult. I'm 5'7 (not tall) and I found them too low. The lower lumbar didn't seem to do anything for me. Also the neck pillow just pushed my neck forward with my squished shoulders. It seems like a chair mostly for a smaller person. I will be moving back to my older chair and giving this to a younger person.
Two bolts are stripped from the factory and the chair is very uncomfortable to sit in. The cushion is very hard and the recline feature is crap. Will be returning

Had high hopes for this chair. Bought it for my home computer desk. Not much padding. However the frustrating part is that the armrest screws need to be tighten every couple of days. I am not rough on chairs and have never had this issue with prior desk chairs I have owned over the years. Wish I could return it. Do not waste your money. But if you do, keep a hex wrench close by.

Chair was easy to install but it is not comfortable at all. I still kept it because I didn't want to go thru the trouble of having to break it down and shipping it since I already thew away the box. I had to buy a cushion and back support. Back support has not insulation and you can see the bar and hurts after a while sitting on the chair. I usually don't do any reviews but for this price I thought it wasn't worth buying.

reviewTitle: Decent chair but not the most comfortable
reviewDescription: The chair was easily assembled with clear instructions. It took me roughly 30 minutes to put together.The chair itself is not super comfortable, but it's not bad. The cushions are not well-padded so the chair feels quite stiff overall. - The back massage cushion is really awkward if you're not using it and the cable is awkward if you are. - The head cushion is too low and just forces me to lean forward a little bit, so I leave those cushions off most of the time. - The leg rest is an awkward length that only goes out to my upper calfThe best use of this chair is to have all cushions on (and the massage function active) while the chair is fully reclined and the leg rest is out. It does make a nice recliner this way, but of course that's not practical for sitting at a desk working or gaming.I definitely don't recommend if you have back problems as I think this chair will make them worse.It's a good price, but you pay for what you get.

reviewTitle: Fast Wear & Tear - Have to Constantly Re-Tighten Bolts
reviewDescription: Pros:  It has done it's job.  I needed a desk chair for my home.Cons:  The wear and tear. Purchased in Oct 2024, and it's June 2024 now.  I have to constantly re-tighten the bolts because the arm portions of the chair get loose.  It's not a terrible chair, but I would prefer higher quality.  I use it daily.  Less than a  year in and I am considering buying a better chair. I hardly use the massage feature or the footrest feature.A five star review for me would mean quality that lasts and comfort that surprises me.A four star review for me would mean more comfortable and does its job better than the average chair.I give it three stars.  Average comfort, disappointed on wear and tear and need to maintain the chair with the re-tightening of the bolts.
It’s ok have kids at home beware

reviewTitle: Comfy and looks nice, but doesn't last
reviewDescription: I really liked this chair but after less than 2 years, the backrest will not stay locked anymore. Leans back with the lightest pressure while it's locked. Armrests also keep loosening itself as well. Just expect to replace it sooner than you'd like
I wanted an extremely comfortable chair - this is not it. It does the job but if you’re sending 8+hours it’s not very comfortable the foot rest is not as easy to push in and out. It gets stuck a lot
dood listen, I put it together pretty good n stuff but them I get to the end and the screw wouldnt fit!!! I had to go to get bigger screws !! screw you!!!
The chair was not as comfortable as advertised. I thought I screwed the bolts tight enough when putting together but the arm still keeps coming loose and falling off

I got this chair about six months ago. It was great when I got it, easy to assemble and comfortable. However, now the padding on the seat has begun to get very flat (I weigh ~180lbs). I ended up ordering a seat cushion and that fixed the issue. But now the back itself is starting to wear out and I can feel the hard plastic through the rear padding.The chair worked great for a while, but the padding wears out fairly quickly. Be warned.

I bought the chair in July of 2023. I have been using it almost every day since I got it. It is comfortable, I like the adjustments that can be made and the lumbar massage is nice. However, one month ago I started to noticing cracks forming on the arm rest. And the cushion is now no longer comfortable. I am now using a computer chair seat cushion. Yes it's economical and yes it is comfortable. But it may not be a long term chair.

This has officially become the last product I ever buy from Amazon. I am sick of the platforms terrible ability to control quality. The screws back out within four or five days of buying it. It has happened so often that I've had to disassemble the entire chair and put loctite on all the screws and reassemble it. I don't expect it to last much longer. Though it may look good it is not comfortable and the noise it makes just sitting it or trying to recline it is unacceptable. The screws backing out started with the arms of the chair and then it became the back of the chair so that it would pop and snap every time you lean back. The compression cylinder has already worked itself loose so the chair wobbles in every direction. The lumbar vibration vibration is super hard and there's no switch so you are going to have to manually plug it in and unplug it each time you want to use it. The chair back has very little to no padding at all and when you recline the chair there is a large gap between the seat and the back. And since the seat is solid in the back you are going to be very uncomfortable unless you slouch. The so-called leg rest will only work if you are under 4 ft tall. Because when you extend it out it lays perfectly horizontal to the ground whereas your legs will be a slight angle which means the back of your calves are going to be resting on the front edge only. There is no way to change this so the leg rest is useless and is also parallel to the seat which means your legs are going to have to stick straight out. Amazon used to be a great place to get things but now they just push absolute junk and their customer service has become inept at their jobs. And when there's a problem with a product Amazon refers you to the seller and usually the seller is in China and they do not care what your problem is. The company told me that they would send me whatever pieces I need and they weren't listening when I explained this whole situation to them that it is not a individual part problem it is the entire chair and the fact that regardless of how tight you tighten the screws they will back out. If you don't put loctite on them it's only a matter of time before they back out enough to either strip the threads or snap the head clean off. You're better off buying a more expensive chair because for $128 I would rather have purchased a bean bag chair. If you're a gamer, that means you probably spend a lot of time gaming and you do not want to sit in this chair for more than the length of a movie or you will be crawling down onto the floor to try to straighten out your back. This chair, just like so many other products that I'm tired of receiving, is absolute junk and you really have no recourse unless you want to box this thing back up and ship it back so they can send you another of the exact same problematic product. Goodbye Amazon, I'll shop brick and mortar even if it cost me 50% more per product simply because I won't have to deal with the headache that comes with being on this platform.

Purchased this to work from home, it was delivered on time but was missing the t-frame (what holds the backrest in place). First day of work was miserable, should have returned it at that point but received the missing part from customer support after a few days.The screws on the chair use an L-wrench. These state that they should only need retightening every 6 months, I was having to realistically do it every 3 weeks after around 2 months or so, with that timeframe reducing to the point where I was retightening the screws every few days.This issue with these screws are prevalent in both the backrest and the armrests. The chair lasted a little over 9 months before the backrest finally gave out today.Return for the chair is only 1 month, not 1 year. 1 year warranty is only for the 'accessories' not to replace the chair or return it.Backrest is missing much needed padding and compensates with the upper and bottom 'cushions'. You can actually feel one of the metal bars going across the backrest (right above the bottom cushion). Armrests are faux leather which will experience peeling after only a few months of fairly light use, not a big issue for me, but I know some people are particular about such things, I usually don't use armrests all that much aside from getting up.Chair is not a very good 'rolling' chair, feels more stationary than both my previous chairs. Felt like when my previous chairs had the wheels locked in place so the chair wouldn't roll.Think twice before you purchase this chair because of a sale or low-price tag. While another chair may be more expensive, it is likely to last you longer and be a better value overall. Moreover, your back will surely thank you for it rather than cutting corners by buying this chair.

reviewTitle: 1 Year Chair - Buyer Beware! Read Before Buying!
reviewDescription: Purchased this to work from home, it was delivered on time but was missing the t-frame (what holds the backrest in place). First day of work was miserable, should have returned it at that point but received the missing part from customer support after a few days.The screws on the chair use an L-wrench. These state that they should only need retightening every 6 months, I was having to realistically do it every 3 weeks after around 2 months or so, with that timeframe reducing to the point where I was retightening the screws every few days.This issue with these screws are prevalent in both the backrest and the armrests. The chair lasted a little over 9 months before the backrest finally gave out today.Return for the chair is only 1 month, not 1 year. 1 year warranty is only for the 'accessories' not to replace the chair or return it.Backrest is missing much needed padding and compensates with the upper and bottom 'cushions'. You can actually feel one of the metal bars going across the backrest (right above the bottom cushion). Armrests are faux leather which will experience peeling after only a few months of fairly light use, not a big issue for me, but I know some people are particular about such things, I usually don't use armrests all that much aside from getting up.Chair is not a very good 'rolling' chair, feels more stationary than both my previous chairs. Felt like when my previous chairs had the wheels locked in place so the chair wouldn't roll.Think twice before you purchase this chair because of a sale or low-price tag. While another chair may be more expensive, it is likely to last you longer and be a better value overall. Moreover, your back will surely thank you for it rather than cutting corners by buying this chair.

I purchased this chair and within the first 2 months it started falling apart.The back rest and seat cushion both had the core structure pieces poking through the cushion causing lots of back pain and very uncomfortable. The arm rests became unstable as well. Within the first 6 months of having the item the arm rest had fallen off, and the cushions were coming apart. I reached out to the seller to request a refund and was advised no refund could be offered however they could honor the warranty purchased with the chair by sending me replacement pieces. They sent the bottom cushion to me without any tools/devices to put the cushion together, and while waiting for this piece to arrive the right armrest completely fell off. I reached out to seller again to replace the back rest and right arm rest and request the required tool to put the pieces together. The seller advised they would send the tracking info ASAP. 10 DAYS goes by and I hear nothing. I finally reached out to check the status of this item and was advised that they are unable to fulfill my order due to lack of inventory, and they would not be able to refund me for the chair either. In addition to that, they advise they don’t know when the inventory issue will be resolved or when they will be able to provide me with the replacement parts.I requested a refund again due to them not being able to fulfill the warranty I paid for, or replace my chair and they refuse.Not only is the chair bad quality and falls apart, but they also have terrible customer service, lack of follow up, and will refuse to refund you even though they can’t provide you with the tools and replacement parts that you paid for!If you are considering this item, DONT! Take your business to a different seller with better quality items!

I’ve fallen out of this chair multiple times and have hurt myself because the hydraulic cylinder never seated properly no matter how many times I wrenched it back out and tried to place it back in straight up and down. The pieces for the base never fit together properly, only three out of the five caster wheels ever touched the ground, causing it to lean and make my back ache from my hips sitting so unevenly for eight hours a day. I work from home, if you do too, steer clear of this chair. This is the second chair I’ve lost hundreds of dollars on, because Amazon will not give me a refund unless I ship the chair back to the seller WHICH IS CRAZY. If I kept every box that I was mailed just in the off chance I would have to mail something back, I would have no room left in my home. Amazon claimed that I could simply disassemble the chair and put it in a ups box large enough to fit all the pieces, but I don’t trust anyone to give me my money back if I did that. Most sellers want all of the original packing that came with the item, which is just a clever way to not offer anyone refunds. Horrible. I’ve thrown away so much of my hard earned money because of things like this.

reviewTitle: Lasted one month longer than the warranty
reviewDescription: At first I was extremely happy with this chair. The back massager was great, but then the new chair feeling began to wear off. I spend almost all day in front of a computer and have a service connected disability, so I purchase a chair with more weight allowance than I place into it. The seat cushion became hard after a few months and I have almost damaged my USB ports several times trying to get out of the chair  with the message cushion still plugged into the USB port needed to power it. 5 feet seems like a decent length until you realize that you need 6-8 to back away from a desk to stand up. So I am reduced to using only on days that it is too uncomfortable to stand up, lie down, or sit for very long. The leg rest is kind of nice and would probably work great for a pre-teen or short adult (under 5' 5") I am 5'11" so the rest sits just below  the knees, about mid to upper calf when I sit in the chair with my back resting on the massager. This results in the blood circulation being cut off to the feet after 30 minutes or so.This chair was rated at 250 lbs. The VA doc told me last month that I weigh less than 220. So it is hard for me to understand why the weld or whatever is used to hold the front of the arm brace to the central seat portion has broken. The left arm now lays off to the side and is wide enough that I cannot rest my arm on it comfortably when sitting in the center of the seat. I do not trust a chair with wheels on the bottom of it to try and stand up so I know that is not the issue, same with sitting down.I have contacted the seller about the issue and will try to update this review with their response.

Chair is meant to support an adult up to 300lbs. I am 6ft tall and 180Lbs, and this chair is barely wide enough for my 33inch waist to both sit/lean-back in. It has to be at the lowest setting to allow my feet to touch the ground giving me a correct 90degree knee bend for posture. This is not ergonomic in any sense, as I've used a month now and am developing right hip pain. The front of the chair and side of the chair look like the photos posted on product page, but the backing is not shown. There is a good reason for that as the chair back attaches to the chair seat via a large metal bracket that is ugly and machine shopped as poorly as the rest of the components showing large welding spots. This is very visually upsetting as well as visually shows poor workmanship. The backing needs to be adjusted every few days as it is only hand tightened without a locking feature, and keeps sliding downward over time. This chair already creaks as much as the chair it was meant to replace which was a no-name brand and over 12 years old. I followed the lame GT Racing "support suggestions" (just re-tighten the screw-end of support), and re-tightened the screws, and it helps with the problem. However, this is less then 2 months in and I've had to readjust the backing, and screws 5 times. The armrests are incredibly flimsy (visually would be nice if they had covers for the screw holes or provided black screws so you didn't have to see them after assembly (every other manufacturer has figured this out decades ago). The look isn't of concern to me, but the fact that they are not durable or safe is. The armrests are very cheap with the smallest of washers actually holding the arms to the chair tight. These armrests are not safe to use to help you push up or sit down into the chair. Like previously mentioned, I am only 180Lbs, and I cannot put more then a few pounds of pressure on the arm rest without them bending outward. This will clearly leave them broken within the year if not 6 months. So be very careful as I was not and check warranty, 1 year or less = junk that will either barely make the mark or fail spectacularly beforehand.

reviewTitle: To put it together you function as a factory worker with damaged parts
reviewDescription: I got this on Prime Day. I have multiple vertebral fractures from stage IV breast cancer and was looking for a nice reclining chair to work remotely in. There's about 300 pieces- none of it is put together already. My son put it together- he even hammered a broken piece back into the correct shape. It was quite the project! Honestly, it seems like a hoax as it's not just putting things together so it ships in a smaller box- you must assemble the entire thing. It costs $25 -30 to return so really not worth returning. When you sit on it, there's no way to control the angle of the recline- it's either straight up or fully back. I much prefer my zero gravity lawn chair to work in and my son inherited this.

This just arrived and I spent a full half hour on step 1 trying to place the wheels in only to find that they dont fasten in place, at all. When turning the thing around to go through more steps, the wheels fall out and it's literally impossible to put them back in unless the thing is upside down. Rinse and repeat. Not dealing with this when I have to work a 12 hour shift.Edit: I'm highly incompetent and learned that yes, the wheels do click into place! It only requires you to use the force of two colliding black holes to do it. Took me about an hour or more to put the entire chair together. Its recommended that you have two people put it together, but c'mon. You're getting this chair if you're a gamer. 0x0 is still zero and that's exactly how many friends we have.Overall I really enjoy the chair. It's pretty comfortable and seriously worth the 159 I paid. It did come in with a tear at the top of the seat but the tears in my eyes from my loneliness hides it pretty well. The massage cushion is also just alright but I enjoy using it while I game, it helps soothe my lower back just enough. If you're just like me and this is your first gaming chair but you're also fat enough to eat a full pizza and still get hangry, be warned that the chair doesnt allow for nearly as much sitting leg room as a normal office chair would. With that being said, it's easy to get used to.Edit: Purely for the sake of keeping the stupid crap I put fir this review, I wont be editing what's been said, but man...don't get Gaming Chairs. A week after I wrote this review the back of chair began to bend to the side. As it was my only chair, I had to keep using it.
