The side it was leaning towards caused that side of my back to become virtually incapacitated as when I moved it around, it caused me extreme pain.It's possible I was simply incompetent when putting the chair together, but after doing extensive research, you'll find it's not worth buying a gaming chair. They're cheaply made with low ergonomic design, low comfort, overpriced with a "GAMER" tag added onto them. They will cause back issues, they will hurt your poor tooshie, and most of all, they dont even last long. If you're thinking of buying a chair, just buy a nice office chair. You can slap a nice Gaming logo on it and boom, you've got a gamer chair that actually beneficial to you. Gaming Chairs look cool but have absolutely no practical use when you realize just how important it is to take care of your body.If you want to pay 150+ for back problems, be my guest!

reviewTitle: Get what you pay for TERRIBLE
reviewDescription: The chair is very cheap. Probably a quarter of an inch of pad under the bum area and then your sitting on hard plastic.It will still not roll as they should. It’s like you’re in cement even though I have hardwood floors. I should be sliding across as if I’m on ice. I contact customer service in regards to the problem with the casters and I’m spoken to as if I’m a child and how I should understand that different floor surfaces could affect the operation of the casters. I did not appreciate the way customer service just made an assumption as if I was an absolute idiot, and didn’t know how a caster should roll across the floor.  Again I have hardwood floors. I should slide across it very easily. The issue I reported with the casters as if they were locked in place. These casters do not have a locking switch on them so that should not be the case. They do not spin and swivel as they should nor do they roll very well.As far as the armrest go, they have already loosened up quite a bit. I feel that this is a very cheap game chair. Those chairs probably worth maybe $50. And if that is probably giving it too much credit.I bought this chair based on the mass of amount of reviews. I thought that wow this chair has a lot of positive reviews a lot of review counts. It must be a good chain . It is not! I hope that you weigh your decision and think long and hard before you purchase any chair. I do not recommend this chair whatsoever.Please know not to base your decision on the amount of reviews, because there could be hidden reviews in there that aren’t even pertain to the item.
This chair is exactly how it is showed in the picture! The chair has a back massager and a pull out foot rest! Money well spent Great investment!

reviewTitle: Almost reclines, great chair, great price
reviewDescription: Bought for my husband who was planning on taking it to his work. When we got it set up, he realized it would almost recline. So…he couldn’t take to work bc he would get too sleepy! He works from home sometimes so he is going to get good use of it at home instead. (Don’t worry, It can’t recline where we have our desk set up at! Lol!)
Love the flex this chair has! I purchased for my office and I may purchase another one for my home office! The massager is an added bonus 😍

reviewTitle: Easy to put together! Hope they restock pink soon!
reviewDescription: Got this chair for my boyfriend’s birthday! Put it together by myself in about an hour. I hope they restock the pink color soon! I’m jealous and want my own. I love it so much!😭
This is the chair for you or your child!  Looks cool.  Fits perfectly.  You can raise/lower the seat.  It fits right up to a gaming table...not overly large and cumbersome.

reviewTitle: Great chair for gaming and chilling out
reviewDescription: Loved how easy it was to assemble. Looks great and perfect for the gamer!

This seems like a really great chair. If you have pets get the leather one because Animal hair sticks to this thing like crazy...The arm's on this chair will come loose no matter how  many times you Tighten them down. The current chair I purchased had to have lock Tight and lock washers attached to it to fix this issue. This chair is exactly what I ordered and  I am extremely Happy with my Purchase.

I hate the pull out leg rest that’s just more difficult than a lever but that’s all gaming chairs. It works great though! Definitely worth buying. Set up was difficult if u need the letters to the parts because not all the parts where labeled but I’m good with the pictures. They even give you extra screws if u lose them for setting up! It’s comfy but the massage part is on the lower pillow and u have to plug it in a usb port. I plug it into my computer. It is comfortable. Seems sturdy!
Son loves it. It’s a great chair. Very sturdy
Chair looks great nice to sit on and was easy to put together

Saw this had great reviews, so I bought one to replace a similar but more expensive chair ($250) from a local Swedish furniture warehouse that was making too much noise after a few years of use.There is no comparison. This chair looks great, but is very badly designed from an ergonomic standpoint. The seat cushion is far too hard, and after hours of being seated (I'm a lightweight person on the thin side) my backside was in pain and turned red. After about a week of use, I also noticed my spine being dug into by a hidden horizontal bar in the middle section of the chair back. Absolutely horrible, human-unfriendly  implementation.This chair is cheap, good looking and a lot of people say they like it. But when you get it and sit in it for 8 hours a day, it's pure torture to your body because of hard bars and planks that are hidden behind a thin layer of soft looking faux leather.Spend the extra money and go to thee Swedish store, where you can try before you buy. This thing is going where it deserves, in the dumpster!
Cheap materials overall. Armrest, seat and the back support is bad. I should’ve bought something have the price and better made to be honest. I regret badly this purchase.

TL;DR - Overall, this chair was constructed to handle the weight but fell short in using plastic materials that did not hold up and design flaws that made it uncomfortable for those with larger frames.I bought this specifically because I have a larger frame and, as such, needed a chair to stand up to the weight requirement. The steel construction of the frame itself and the quality of the pneumatic that adjusts the height is above par.However... The plastic wheels, after only a few months of use, have broken at the axle and fallen apart. Also, the footrest relies on plastics that have begun to stretch out of place or broken and no longer support my legs comfortably. To top it off, the seat itself has "wings" going up the side of it that has irritated and bruised my hips. Also, the covering on the armrests and seat has begun to decay, horribly cracking, splitting, or being worn down far more quickly than it should be given the cost and age.

reviewTitle: Falls apart after a short while
reviewDescription: I ordered this for support while using my laptop at the desk or to kick back and relax and put my feet up and read, so I use the chair a lot. After 2 months the screws started coming loose and everything needed to be retightened. Then the little plastic wheel parts started popping off randomly. Now I am popping a wheel half back on almost every day, almost every time I move the chair one falls off. Frustrating and low quality wheels. The rest of the chair is nice, the adjustable head pad is good and the lumbar support is good. I did buy a gel cushion for the seat because I use it so much. I am a partly disabled veteran with arthritic back issues so I sit a lot. The massage feature is OK on the lumbar cushion, you have to be very careful with the cord while using it so you don't get tangled. The foot rest is a bit short but functional.I wanted to give it a better rating but just cannot with the wheels falling off so often. Really could use better wheels and then I'd say it's a 4.

After reading all the great reviews on this chair I’m really mad that I bought it. It was great for a couple of days then the arm started getting loose and now the other arm is peeling! He literally got it on Christmas morning and here it is Jan 2 and pretty much falling apart. For $130 this is pure crap!

Was good price when I got it. But the chair does feel very stiff and it makes alot of noise!! It cracks and it's actually not a comfortable. The foot rest also is very stiff to pull out and hard to push back in. I rate this a 2.5 because of its functionality, comfort and noise...

I never did get to try out the lumbar massage, one of the main reasons for buying the chair. The seat bottom was so hard and uncomfortable, it didn't even hit me where my knees bend, it hit about 4 or 5 inches from my knees. I'm short too so that is never an issue for me. I've had spine surgery and from the lack of cushioning that caused my leg to go numb. I am returning the chair for that reason.Sitting on it felt like sitting on a surface of brick. The chair is nice otherwise, the head rest is comfortable as is the back of the chair. The chair assembled easily.The seller shipped the chair in good time and was received as promised.

reviewTitle: Cheap quality, you get what you pay for
reviewDescription: This is my first Gaming Chair. Everything about this chair is mediocre. They even give you a warning to tighten screws every few weeks or months. The way this product is designed made it impossible to completely tighten the bolts on the armrest joints; it took less than 24 hrs for one of the armrests to come off. I tested the bolts for armrest joints without the armrest and they are capable of being fully tightened. However the way this product is designed, makes it impossible to tighter the bolts on the armrests joints with the armrests attached. Having a stable armrest is a key element of a good office chair;  this chair lacks that.

reviewTitle: Hard as a rock. Plan for short term usage.
reviewDescription: Overall the chair is about what you pay for in quality. That is to say, it’s not crazy high quality, but it’s not falling apart at the seams, either. I couldn’t figure out why it was so uncomfortable at first, but after a few weeks it became overwhelmingly clear. The seat of this chair is hard as a rock. At first it’s manageable but after a few hours it’s agonizing. I have to put a pillow or blanket down.The “cushion” on it must be less than 1” thick, atop thick metal. Someone in the Q&A says “the seat needs to be thick enough so that when you lean forward, it doesn’t feel like sitting on hard stone” and that’s exactly what this chair is like - hard stone.If you plan to game for more than 4 hours - this is NOT the chair for you.

reviewTitle: Good chair but terrible add on’s
reviewDescription: The chair seems solid/sturdy. However, the massaging feature stopped working after 15 minutes of us. Will not turn back on. The recline piece seems so unstable that we don’t use it. Just shop for a chair itself. No extra massage or recline feature. It will save you money!

It looked great but when my husband was putting it together he warned me that he thought it was junk. The back seemed very loose to him and the metal was cheap. After 3 weeks the back broke! My son is less than 120 lbs. and was just sitting in it when suddenly the back and one arm came loose on him. It took hours of gentle hammering to get the back in place, but we could tell it was destined to happen again so we had to return it. Even with a full refund We wasted $29.99 on shipping and another $11 on a new box to ship it back. Do NOT recommend.

I got this as a gift for my 120-130lb boyfriend less than a year ago, the wear and tear appeared months ago but I’m finally getting around to making the review. It would be understandable if my it had developed over years or if my boyfriend wasn’t underweight but that isn’t the case. He’s the only person who has sat in it.

Just got it two weeks ago the arms are loose already like they’re pulling away from the chair and the vibrator completely shut off. Don’t work now. I had this for two weeks. I give this not even a one star much money as you pay for that chair, it should not do any of that in that little time.

It is very uncomfortable. There is no spring for the back recliner to go up or down properly.But the problem I have is that when I adjust and set on it. it will go down very slowly. I was going to send it back but the company contacted me and asked to keep it and they would send a new tube. I agreed to it but they never sent me the replacement gas tube. The return window ran out and I have useless junk.They asked me if I needed to take a video of it. I replayed back to them that it was not a sudden drop. it takes a long while before it is all the way down. I was not ready to make a 30 minutes video.

The chair looks and feels like its going to fall apart any second. The seat part is hard and the head pillow only rest at my shoulders never my head, I'm 5'10 the chairs only has up and down, no tilt. The Lumbar pillow doesn't have a switch to turn it on or off so if you want to use it stop what your doing to find a USB 2or3 port.

Okay chair that is somewhat comfortable, id only buy it on discount. The back of the chair is not very thick. You pretty much have your back on nothing padded and to make things worse there’s some kind of metal bar that is very uncomfortable to lean on. I will likely have to find a pillow or attachment to fix this. Haven’t really used it in “work” mode but I’m assuming you’ll still feel that bar. I honestly feel bad for anyone that bought this at full price. It is not a near 200$ chair what so ever. (Edit):The longer I have the chair the more I wanna throw it out. They seriously put tissue paper as the back padding. I will be trying to get my money back. This chair is a joke. Iva had the chair maybe a week already having back pain. If they don’t refund me Amazon better cause this is a joke. There’s no way any of those reviews are real and if they are they got the item for free. Please don’t buy this chair. Unless you hate yourself and your back

reviewTitle: The rest of arms does not reach
reviewDescription: I have not yet received this part the chair came defective and I saw it when I already had all armed so I did not return it. I need you to send me that part I have requested many times and no one respond.

I ordered this because it’s going so viral and it was one of the most inexpensive options but it’s been nothing but regret since then it’s relatively comfortable I guess but the seat is small and the “extra support” cushions are a joke. And the pictures I included is when the chair originally came with two right arms. I contacted the seller and they responded fast and shipped out a new one, the new one is a left arm but for a completely different chair. Thankfully I was still able to Jerry rig it enough to work but ultimately this is a waste of money I’m tired of capitalism making us buy these things over and over instead of building them right.

reviewTitle: Haven’t even had it a year
reviewDescription: Got this chair for my son 16 year old son and  haven’t even had it a year yet and it is broken. He’s not rough with it at all. In fact he has taken good care of it but went to sit in it the other day and the piece that connects the base to the top broke. Sad to see something that cost so much fail!

reviewTitle: Poor quality and broke after Les than a month
reviewDescription: Very Poor quality the main jack weld broke all around while a 13 year old kid was using it, the weight rating is misleadingThis could’ve hurt my son while sitting on it.I don’t recommend
Is very comfortable !!

I've gone through a few chairs over the years. I've tried office chairs and 'gaming' chairs alike, but they always left me achy and would break down over the course of a few years. I take exquisite care of my stuff (frfr I'm a germaphobe) but I'd have chairs start to tear or fray and leave my back hurting SO bad that it'd make my stomach hurt. I can't say I have the best posture on the face of the planet since I am hyper-mobile but it was ridiculous. I decided to give this chair a try because of the reviews and it seemed reasonably priced compared to the Titan Evo chairs I was looking into ($800).Assembly: Took me a little longer than expected, the instructions aren't the best but are relatively straightforward.Comfort: Fabulous. I can sit criss cross. I can sit like a shrimp. I can kick back and watch a movie. I can hunch over to do my homework. OR I can even sit properly (sometimes). I've never had a sore back no matter how long I've sat in the chair.Price and quality: I'd say this is mid tier quality. A step above "you get what you pay for" and a step below "overpriced gucci chair" that most companies market towards gamers to price gauge the title of 'gaming chair'.Is it worth it? Yes. I think you are mostly paying for functionality here and not style or aesthetic. Just a generic ol' gamer chair.
Incredible chair, very comfortable and in addition to being reclining and having a footrest, it also offers massage👌
Very comfortable and really easy to put together. Takes maybe 10-15 mins to put together and instructions are very straightforward. Overall I'm very pleased with my purchase.
This was a birthday gift for my grandson Noah,  it massages  his back while he plays his games. He lives it

reviewTitle: Easy assembly and great for someone with scoliosis who works at a desk!
reviewDescription: I spend a lot of time at a desk. I work from home, go to grad school and I like to game and write in my spare time. I have back issues due to a congenital condition, so a comfortable and supportive chair is very important. I sprang for this one because I really, really needed a better chair than the one I had. I'm not the best at putting things together without a visual like a video,  but the instructions were clear and very easy to follow. I was able to put it together myself, shaking hands, motor control issues and all!The chair is so comfortable and feels sturdy when I sit in it. I have really long legs and the seat itself doesn't feel too short to me at all. The foot rest is a fantastic feature; I will say that it's a bit shorter than I will like, but I chalk that up to my legs being so long. Even with that, putting my feet up at work and being able to recline is a godsend on long days. The armrests feel sturdy and come up to a comfortable height. I tried the massaging lumbar support; it was a bit loud but it's by no means a deal breaker.If you're on a budget and are looking for a gaming or office chair, I would recommend this one for sure! If my husband likes it, I may even get him one.
Great chair,perfect gift for my daughters Birthday. Came 2 days earlier then date given.
Gift for my son dad for his birthday. He loves it!!!

I have only two issues regarding this chair, one is price related and one is actually chair related (but minor):1. Shipping Cost: $30 for shipping is insane. It’s a big, heavy item, I get it. But I almost didn’t buy this chair because of the shipping costs, but it had good reviews, looked the way I wanted it to in the pics, and I had an extra coupon I applied to it.2. The footrest is great, BUT it is very hard to pull out. I like that because it means it’s not easy to accidentally push it with my feet, but it also means when I’m very tired and comfy and wish to adjust the footrest it is a PROCESS to get it to move.Overall though, this chair is great. I personally recommend having a second person to help you put it together (at least if you’re inexperienced like me) specifically to put the back on. It’s super comfy, I love the little pillow behind my head, and I love how I can lay down in it or sit up. It’s a little too tall for my desk even at its lowest, but that’s because I’m in a college dorm 😅 I definitely recommend this chair!
Very comfortable.
Ok iz a chair note good if you a fatty like me T 300 not comfortable after 2hrs like the vibration cam buy N extra hour with that function 😅
My 14 year old son loves it… but it is not for bigger people, he fits just fine but for an adult it wouldn’t last long
Color is amazing, love that the back vibrates but it gets so uncomfortable after sitting in it for about an hour… maybe it’s just me..

reviewTitle: Good for short-term but the quality shows over time.
reviewDescription: If you need a decent chair for a couple months until you can save for a better one, then this would be a great pick. It will get the job done but the quality is sub-par at best, when it arrived the leather had cuts in some places and when screwed on i noticed the armrests were a bit loose despite being tightened all the way. The "massage pillow" is a literal brick that shakes(straight into the trash) and a pillow was needed on the underside due to little to no cushioning. But I looked past all this as it was all either visual issues or resolved easily. What was not easily resolved or ignored was when the weld on the base sheered away like nothing in the matter of a night, which is not what I'd expect from a chair that is moderately used by someone 170lbs, I had owned the chair for just over a year and one night it just gradually leaned further and further back until it snapped. If you need a chair in a pinch this will do but it is overall your typical mass produced Chinese garbage with no quality control, invest a little bit more in a better one or break this one within a year so you can get your money back from the warranty.

This is my first gaming chair. It looks great, was affordable and easy to put together. I love that it has a foot rest. However, I have had it almost 6 months now and the padding is gone. I feel all the structure bars in the back, seat and footrest. It is uncomfortable. I had to add a pillow to sit on.It also squeaks and groans. And a couple bolts come loose regularly, no matter how tight I turn them.

Its a good chair so far no major issue but it could be improved in two area's1) Good fabric could be used, current fabric is flimsy.2) It should be more thicker, overall chair is very thin from every angle resulting in less cushion which will be pressed in long term.(You can feel bones of chair ;) )

pretty weak chair honestly, after buying 2 of them. both now being sat on and across from me. I can state the speed of break down is insanely bad..what is worse is the second one came with a super stripped out 1 of 4 mounts for the back of the chair itself.Quality control does not appear to be there on these models.I am not sending that bad chair back, instead i just fixed it myself.

reviewTitle: do not recommend to buy it at all
reviewDescription: It is not comfortable at all!!! I bought it for my back pain because I need to sit in front of my computer for long hours. But this chair is not good and comfortable at all. although the massage feature is good.

There is a bar in the middle of the back support that hits you like a 1970s pull out bed. Pillow helps but then you have to deal with a short seat. I ended up buying something else; just wish it worked out better.
The chair looks nice but the bolts come undone too easy. Have to keep tightening it down. It’s just annoying! It warns you it will happen but I didn’t think it would that much.
The welding already broke and chair goes too low :( only had for a month
cant even move without SQUEAK SQUEAK SQUEAK. comfortable atleast.

Put this chair together - is semi comfortable- squeaks  A Lot / arm rests are too low - though it would be comfortable for me since I’m a medical coder and working from home - so far seat is a little to firm - will give it a few more days - not sure

My kid was insistent on getting this game chair due to the brand and color.  The quality is okay, not as good as others I have had in the past.  Installation and directions were pretty straight forward.  Looks good, not that comfortable.  For the price I expected more but my kid is happy so that is what matters.

Pros: Straight forward to assemble, and feels solid.Arm and seat cushions are comfortable.Cons: The back has absolutely no cushion to speak of - just metal bars covered by some leather,  making it fairly uncomfortable. Though I suppose this helps you get into the correct posture, hunched over the keyboard.

So after roughly using it for over a month, here are my thought.Pro- Easy to assemble- Cheap- Good lookingCon- Not very comfortable, might be due to me being heavy at 220+ lb.- The armrests constantly loosen, I have to tighten the screws every other day.

While it may seem its comfortable to sit in, It is quite stiff and the cushioning is quite stiff as well, while the foot rest is nice again it is still a bit uncomfortable. I would say pass on this chair if you get uncomfortable easily and do not like like Firm steating.
Decent chair decent for the price

reviewTitle: Good Chair for the price. Difficult to put together.
reviewDescription: For the price it is an overall decent chair and the ability to recline is very nice.Putting the chair together was overall very difficult and I had to retighten the arms multiple times as they came loose.I also appear to be missing the screws for the foot rest and though I was told I would be sent new screws that has not yet happened.Overall it’s not bad but it is flawed.

Bought this chair for my nephew nice comfortable chair but there was a few issues with it after the first week the vibration pad stopped working and one of the arm rest won't stay tighten felling a little disappointed 😑
It is popping loudly, clicks and is noisy all the time, wouldn't waste my time or money on this chair.

reviewTitle: Not worth it getting at all
reviewDescription: The chair does not have the great balance. Not only that but the back part of the chair is so bad in terms of sitting  angles. You will have to bend to sit straight.

reviewTitle: Its broke after a few months
reviewDescription: Dont buy ive onky had the chair for a few months and the reclining feature is broken never actually used that feature but now the chair just leans backend forward with no way to lock it in place the material used for that chair is also cheap plastic leather the massager is a cheap rubber that heats up rapidly when using and the lumbar pillow straps are way to short and rip the pillow -1/10 don't buy

Update: This chair has found its way to the garbage. AVOIDAfter a year use review. (See review edit 3 months after this review at the bottom, reduced rating to 2 stars. )Decent chair, but I can see some issues if you’re a heavier person. There are 2 wheels per castor, and 2 wheels now come off when moving the chair around. Will have to buy new wheel castor to replace them now.Edit December 2023: The bottom bracket for the left armrest has ripped out of the seat. Several wheels pop off now if rolled around. I am not a big person so this chair hasn’t been abused. If looking for a chair I would recommend spending the extra money and getting something of higher build quality that will last and avoid these Amazon fake gaming chairs.

After a few weeks the chair began clicking everytime I sit down ( I’m only 145lbs) I tried to tighten bolts, un tighten bolts nothing worked then the “leather” (which is more plasticy than fake leather) started cracking pretty bad then after like 2 more months it started peeling and scratching my arms. Also the seat pretty much has no cushion it feels like I’m sitting on the floor with a thin blanket under me

I am 5'10" / 140lbs. the back relies on the pillow that came with it to make it comfortable and it does a terrible job. there is a metal bar sticking out in the worst spot and no cushion at all. the seat is way too firm to be comfortable for any more than maybe 30 mins. the arm rests keep loosening up for no reason so I have to dig the allan wrench out and tighten it back up every week or so. the foot rest is secured by cheap plastic so I don't even use it out of fear it's gonna break. I had to both buy a better seat/back cushion AND put a different, better pillow on the back just to make this chair even mildly comfortable to sit in. just spend the extra money to get a chair that's more comfortable because this one is awful.
Did not last very long. Purchased in Dec. ‘22 and it didn’t even last a year before falling apart, and has become rock hard to sit on.
arms started pulling out on but it weren`t loose  glad I got the extended warranty and base screws loosened up and started making a cracking sound

reviewTitle: Cheaply made. No cushion , It just looks nice online.
reviewDescription: Cheaply made. not cushiony at all. . I wish I had time to return it

reviewTitle: Just buy a office chair avoid this product
reviewDescription: Owned for over 3 months and the screws would loosen from daily use causing them to fall off within the first few weeks, So I fixed it using loctite. Then the screws broke inside making it completely unusable. Not that comfortable compared to a office chair.

I have been going back an forth with this company since the day we put it together. The directions were easy and my son and I had no problem following the instructions and putting it together. (massage chair wires were tore apart out of the box) After he used the chair for two hours the chair was tilting. I reached out to the company immediately for a new chair. They would not send a new chair but offered a misley $15 credit. I am constantly being asked to take pictures. They ok'd a new massage pillow, even though I just asked for new wires, but couldn't see the tilt for the first few go arounds of pictures. Finally did... now want pics of mechanisms. IT IS BS!!! This company should have sent a new chair day one. I'm tired of having to prove my claims. I still have no wires, no credit... they want to wait to figure out what parts to send me...but I am not taking this chair apart to fix it. The whole process is ridiculous. DO NOT BUY GAMING CHAIR FROM THIS COMPANY, a chair should last longer than a day!!! (I am warning you) If I could give zero I would, they don't even deserve one star.

reviewTitle: Issues with seller- Item was defect
reviewDescription: They sent me a defective product. When I asked they replaced the part with a used one.

Assembly was easy but the foot rest does not line up with the plastic mounts on the bottom of the chair and there is no way to adjust these to make it fit.  The foot rest is completely useless because of this.  Also, the padding on the back is non-existent.  The frame of the back feels like it just has a covering of fabric.  Returned due to the foot rest.

reviewTitle: Particle board in frame of the chair disenegrated in less than 6 months
reviewDescription: Purchased this for my 12 year old son that likes gaming and wieghs only 140 pounds.....The main back piece is made of particle board that literaly disengrated and now the chair is not usuable. It aslo left a mess of "wood" in the room as well.You get what you pay for.

Took me a very short amount of time to assemble, and it was an easy to finish project. But the design makes it inherently uncomfortable. A metal rod run horizontally right where just under my shoulder blades naturally rest and their is only a thin layer of material between that and the rest of the padding for the chair. No matter what position i contort myself, i can always feel the bar and it gets unpleasant overtime.Only thing i can positively say is that it was on the cheaper side.EDIT:THIS DAMN CHAIR IS SO UNCOMFORTABLE, I CAN'T SIT DOWN IN THIS THING FOR MORE THAN 15 MINUTES BEFORE I FEEL HOW BAD IT HURTS. LITERALLY WORSE THAN YOUR AVERAGE CHAIR ON AN AIRPLANE

reviewTitle: fast delivery, horrible padding and comfort
reviewDescription: super fast delivery, however as a highest rated gaming chair it is terrible. After seated for 5 minutes already started having numbness. Chair is made out of cheap material, as well as the smell of the dye is noxious. Pets wont even stay in the same room due to odor. I will not continue to use this chair and have already began looking for a different option. A metal folding chair is more comfortable.
It's a chair like any other, it is better to buy an office chair.I don't recommend it because it's a little uncomfortable on the back.

reviewTitle: spend the money on something else
reviewDescription: I got this as my first gaming chair. It was hard to put together for one person but it is doable. I’ve only been using it for 3 months and already one arm is lose and I have to constantly tighten it for it just to lose back up. After awhile of sitting to it become really uncomfortable as there seems to not be much padding at all in the seat. Spend the money on something else !

The seat cushion feels like you are sitting on plywood and the backing has zero padding. I mean zero, it is just the fake leather and the metal bars creating the shape. Because of that, you feel every bar digging into your back. Complete waste of money.

I would put 0 stars if possible. This chair broke right away! Customer Service is a joke! They want to send all these parts that you need to hammer with a mallet to repair the chair. Along with these videos to follow to replace them as if they have constant issues with the same parts. Didn’t even last a week. Save your money and look for a quality chair; this is not quality!

This chair, even at $60, is a complete waste of your money!I bought this chair for my 110lb daughter a year ago and the wheels fall off constantly, the cushion is completely flat, the pleather causes skin irritation and is peeling off.Complete trash!I would never ever ever recommend this garbage chair to anyone for any reason!She's better off sitting on a cardboard box!

You have to really forced the arms into place when putting the screws in. On top of that, they sent me the wrong screws for the back to mount on the bottom. I had some extras from my previous chair but they didn’t fit right. I called the company and they said they would send me new screws in a couple days. That was about a month ago and they never showed.It is also worth noting the leather on the chair is really nice but it is poorly put together and has almost no cushion inside the leather. You can feel every piece of the frame when you sit in it. The leg rest is not a bonus as it’s barely usable. It sticks out maybe a foot and is supported by 2 pieces of plastic mounted under the chair so it flexes whenever you try to use it. The back massager doesn’t really do anything and has to be plugged in to barely vibrate.All in all it’s a decent gaming chair, hut if you can get one cheaper without the leg rest or back massager I would because it’s not worth the price.

Have had the chair for just over 2 months now and it’s already showing how cheap it is. I know this is by no means a high quality product but after 2 months I would expect something better. All the screws constantly need tighting, the arm screws anchors are broken causing the arm screws to be barely anchored in. The arm cushions and lumbar support pillow have gone flat. The fabric doesn’t breathe at all so expect sweaty pants. Overall for $100 just save up to get something that’s more comfortable and durable. If you’re on a budget and looking for a gamer chair I would recommend a mesh back chair instead of this.

reviewTitle: I PURCHASED TRASH ,The screw holes don't have threads
reviewDescription: We couldn't assemble this chair. We purchased because it was on sale and kept it for some time, when we tried to assemble it, most of the holes didn't have threads so we can't assemble. We threw it to the trash because that's whaylt it is.

reviewTitle: Nice chair but the padding is a little stiff for me
reviewDescription: Bought this chair when on sale during Black Friday for my son. The price point was good but after assembly I found the seat cushioning was a little hard. Some may like a harder seat but not me. My son did not care so we just kept it. There are more comfortable chairs on the market. Not sure were the rating "For Gaming" comes into play as you can sit on a bucket or even the floor and play video games. I know for me when I play to sit for an extended period of time 1-2 hours to game I am looking for a comfortable seat.** Update ** We have had this chair for only 5 months and the weldment that holds the post to the roller leg has broken. Just do yourself a favor and buy a more reputable brand of chair. I'm now out $120 and have to buy a whole new chair.

I bought this for my husband for Father's Day. I paid for shipping and waited about 7 days before we received it. As we were unboxing everything we noticed the Allen wrench and some bolts were stripped. And as you can see in the pictures we couldn't screw the left arm rest in. We are unable to recline the chairm and even the slightest movement the arm rest falls off. Very disappointed in this and how this chair was manufactured.

Had the chair for about a month and the arm rest broke on one side plus i have to keep tightening the screws every couple weeks so it doesn't fall apart while i'm in it but that didn't even matter. It's a decent price but i would get something different if i were you don't waste your money like i did.

Do not buy this chair.So many issues wrong with the frame. The arm rests do not stay you have to keep tightening them because they cheap plastic that you screw into. There is no on or off switch to the vibration just unplug?I was so happy when I got this, a week after it started falling apart. When I contacted the company they told me to “screw the bolt back in” so I have to do this every day now.. no. They would t refund me but Amazon did. I already bought a new chair. Please don’t make the mistake I did.

Please do not waste your money on this. After only half a year, it has already broken beyond reasonable repair. Leaning back in it causes it to recline backwards now, even without using the reclining handle. I feel unsafe sitting in it because I am constantly worried it will lean so far back that it topples and I may hit my head.The assembly guide did warn about this, and said it could be fixed by tightening the screws. I have done so, and the chair is no better at all. I have no clue how to make it back to normal.

We've had this chair for 6 months and it has received daily use. Unfortunately the chair has not held up well at all, the material on the seat and the arms (fake leather) is pealing badly.  Also, all padding has deteriorated.  I would not recommend buying.  This one will be going in the trash.

reviewTitle: Armrest bolt screws did not work
reviewDescription: Very upset because during assembly when i was putting in the armrests, the bolts would not stay in and it felt like the hole they went into was already stripped or too big, I wish I could get a refund but I don't have a box to ship it back in. Make sure the bolts fully fit, if it wasn't for that then this would be a great chair.

We purchased this gaming chair in January for my husband and kids. The chair worked fine until it started slowly falling apart. First the armrest became loose and eventually came off. Then the pole that holds the chair on the legs bent and eventually breaks in half. Luckily no one was hurt but definitely wouldn’t recommend for heavy individuals and commonly used areas.

reviewTitle: Save your money.. spend it on a better quality chair
reviewDescription: Im not saying the chair is terrible, as I knew it wasnt going to be top of the line for the price, however, I should have spent the money on a better quality product.I was sent two left arm chair rest parts so now I have to go without a right arm rest.. very frustrating

The chair overall is ok, my main problem is the right arm rest. Every week I have to retighten the bolt because it comes loose to the point where it wants to fall off. Since i have been doing this since I bought the chair I feel that this is a defective product.

Thought the chair was great at first, but now after about a year it is completely unusable. It started having issues pretty quickly. The wheels never worked well, but that was fine for me. I was having to tighten the armrest screws every day because of how quickly they become loose. Then after a couple months started having issue with the backrest and needing to tighten those screws frequently. Now the chair does not feel stable and is very creaky and loud.

reviewTitle: Broken after less than a year
reviewDescription: I've had this thing for less than a year and it snapped. The bottom bit connected to the legs broke.Never used the extra features as well since I'm a taller guy. The foot rest is too short, the massage bit didn't do anything.

Aesthetically this chair is pretty.  Otherwise,  it's terrible. The seat is very hard. The back pillow massage feature does not work. Zippers are sewn in backwsrds or missing pull tabs. Not worth the money and definitely not worth the effort for assembly.

After a few months of use, the padding becomes flat and you can feel the bars that make up the frame of the chair on your back. Quite uncomfortable to sit in for hours on end while I work. You can unzip the chair and add more stuffing like a pillow or blanket, but it's disappointing that this chair is the same price as many other gamer chairs and is much much less comfortable in a short amount of time. My last chair of the same price held up for 2 years before replacing it whereas this one has lasted 5-6 months and I'm already considering replacing it for how uncomfortable it is.

reviewTitle: Not comfortable for use as an office chair
reviewDescription: The chair went together pretty easily and everything works. If you are looking for a comfortable chair for working at a desk all day, you probably want to pass on this one. The seat is hard, barely cushioned at all and it tilts toward the back of the chair as if it was designed for reclining. I placed a level on it so that you can see just how much of a difference there is from front to back. This is definitely not ergonomically comfortable in any way.I am 5'6" and my behind sits lower than my legs do at the front of the chair which causes a lot of pressure on the back of my legs at the front edge of the chair. This pressure is there no matter if I sit to the back of the chair or scoot toward the center, the pressure on whatever part of my leg is at the front edge of the chair is very intense. I found a box to put under my feet to lift my legs upward and the pressure was relieved. It would be nice if the chair had a seat tilt feature, but it doesn't. Honestly, had I tried out this chair in a store I would have immediately disliked it and done a hard pass on it.I really don't have anything positive to say about this chair other than assembling it was pretty easy and everything was labeled and packed well.

reviewTitle: Good chair but low cushion quality 👀
reviewDescription: The chair is good and comfortable. Theres not much to say other than it is a GOOD CHAIR. The only and most important downside,  is the recliner cushion. There's none. Really Dissapointed on that end. Its like your reclining your back on thin paper. Very very Dissapointed on that. The cushion on the seat is 8/10. The recliner cushion is 3/10. Very Dissapointed.
My chair lasted one month and it is broken because of weak welds! The company will not communicate with me!
DONT BUY THIS CHAIR, the base breaks after a couple months of occasional use. Super cheap, don’t waste your money.
Made very cheaply and is super uncomfortable.
Uncomfortable and the arms fall off easily

There are several issues with this chair in particular but the two main ones are:1. the chair advertises as being comfortable, but there is absolutely no cushioning. not to mention the big wooden beam that runs across the back of the chair in the center of the back.2. the mechanism that controls the leaning back and forth of the chair is cheaply made. even when the lock is in place to prevent the chair from leaning back. you sit back and rest the chair will lean itself back.wish i had known about the issues of this chair, could have saved myself the $100 it cost to get this chair and gotten something more worth my money

I've had this chair for almost 3 months now and I will say that it is good and is of a great quality. That being said, what it has in comfort and appearance, it lacks in build quality. The arm rests are attached via 2 L brackets on each side (4 brackets total). This means that it is extremely easy to bend the bracket when hitting the arm rest and It eventually breaks off. It is strange however since only my right armrest broke off while the left side is still in tact with moderate stiffness. This is a good product but for over $100 USD I expect higher quality especially in a freaking CHAIR. I bought a racing chair for my '00 Honda Civic for less than this. How can you possibly justify a "gaming" chair costing more than an automotive "racing" chair. I will never shop with this store again and will probably just add wheels to an old driver's seat to act as a "gaming" chair.

reviewTitle: Don't buy this chair.  Frame is like tin foil!
reviewDescription: Purchased this for my son who is over 210lbs.  It lasted for 2 months.  The lower frame is very cheaply made.  As the pictures show the chair is on a permanent lean.  Contacted the company and I was told to send pics.  3 weeks and I have not heard anything.  Terrible quality and customer service.

reviewTitle: Fell apart in less than 2 weeks
reviewDescription: The back fell off because the bolts that held it stripped out with normal usage and unable to reassemble because of cheap materials making up the internal frame of the back.

For the price you would expect a decently comfortable chair but it’s not at all. Sit in it for about 30 minutes to an hour and it starts to hurt. Anyone seeing this should just go get an office chair, I had to switch back to my old chair because this chair is just not comfortable like they claim it is.
Im sure the chair is fine. But... if you ever need anything from customer service, good luck.I never received my chair and they refuse to give me a refund.
It is really nice. You can follow the manuals to assemble it.I would rate it as easy for assembling. The foot rest, back support is just great
Love the product. Comfortable and sturdy. It also came earlier than I expected
Love it
Chair arrived in exceptional packaging. Very easy to put together. Was surprised it has a vibration pillow for when seated can get a nice massage. Material is great and no bad odor.

I needed a new office/gaming chair but was hesitant going this route. I had tried gaming chairs before and they just weren’t comfortable for me. I went with this one for the extra reclining distance and the footrest. It was easy to assemble although I did get roller blade style wheels instead of the plastic ones that come with it. It’s comfortable, the head pillow comes handy and I’ve found it comfortable. Actually fell asleep in it for an hour or so the 2nd night. It also has a massage feature but I haven’t used that yet.

reviewTitle: Easy to put together and easy on my back
reviewDescription: It only took me an hour and all the instructions were clear. They even had the nuts and bolts organized in a package that was just a ziplock with a letter on it. Literally every step had things separated. 10/10The chair is nice too.

reviewTitle: I love the Lumbar Support feature of this chair!
reviewDescription: My husband gifted me this chair to help with my lumbar strain. I am so in love with this gaming chair coz it has a massaging feature that helps your back. The height adjustment feature of it is awesome most especially for someone short like me. The padding of the backrest of the chair is so comfortable. The footrest is another thing that I love about it. You can tuck it in if you're done stretching out your legs.

I am thoroughly pleased with my purchase in every aspect. The product I acquired is of exceptional quality, exhibiting versatility and reliability, thereby significantly improving my overall user experience. I would wholeheartedly recommend it to individuals seeking such qualities in a product.

Great quality, sturdiness and material. for the price of this chair you would think it was more expensive. It's really nice. When this one wears out most def buying another one for my son, he absolutely loves it! Great fit to his small set up.

reviewTitle: Cheap quality and very bad smell
reviewDescription: The chair arrived in a cheap box and not very good packaging. The assembly was easy enough. But right off the box, the components, particularly the seat and the back rest had a very strong chemical smell. Not sure if it's Formaldehyde but it can't be good for breathing. There are two controls: up and down  and the back rest moves back and forth. The seat itself does not tilt. The chair may be ok for kids to play video game on, but not for an adult. The vibrating lumbar support makes lots of noise. I would not recommend this chair for home office.  The box says the product is "Made in PRC". I guess it's People Republic of China, which is the mainland China. Why didn't they just say "Made in China"?
Recline already broken, if I lean back the chair falls all the way intoo fully reclined position.

I bought this chair and followed every instruction to the very T. I check 4 times on the instructions and it don't say to prime anything once I got the chair built and tried to raise it, it didn't raise so I took it apart and tried looking over the instructions and put it together again and still won't rasie or lower. I wouldn't recommend for the price and the broken factor it don't rasie or lower.
I guess I'll keep it since I went to all the trouble of assembling it, but this chair is a piece of crap. Instant back ache as soon as you sit. And for being big & tall - it is much too small.

I got this for my son for his birthday. Assembly was pretty easy and straightforward. The seat is SO hard and unless you are a midget, the footrest is useless. For the money I guess you can't expect it to be perfect.  But I did expect better than what I got.

reviewTitle: Recliner broke in less than a year
reviewDescription: I didn’t expect the chair to last long but I definitely didn’t think it was gonna get damaged so early. Only issue I had before the recliner broke in a couple of months was the left armrest cause it was wiggly and it felt fragile compared to the right one. Simply I wouldn’t recommend the chair instead save a bit more money and get something better

This was a Christmas present for my son. The locking mechanism that is used when you lean back to keep it in place has already broke. He is not a heavy gamer or nearly as much as he used to be and he certainly isn't a rough and active player but the locking mechanism is not that durable. I am still collecting information to see if I can manually fix it and I've reached out to the vendor am currently awaiting a reply.

Ok so this chair is really cute…… but not the most functional the biggest thing for me is that the wheels on it do not work trying to roll the chair is nearly impossible. I work from home and have 2 desks so moving from o e to another is really important. Unfortunately this is impossible with this chair I am writing this review a few months in after the purchase I was hoping that with time it would work out. That was not the case. Another thing is that if you buy this chair for the message feature think twice if you are not near an outlet this is useless. I will be having to buy alternative wheels for this chair.

This is the first review I've ever written on a product. I saw the 14,000 or so 4.5 star reviews and saw everyone saying this chair is perfect. Once I put the chair together I was a little skeptical due to how small it was; once I sat down the side edges of the chair dug right into my back. I'm 260 pounds and 6 ft tall, I'm very athletic and naturally larger than the average person; my brother is 175 pounds and 5 ft 9" and he loves the chair. The foot rest seems fragile even to my smaller brother. I would not recommend this chair if you are looking for something sturdy and robust for anyone over 200 pounds.

reviewTitle: Chair is nice but there is a bar going through the back support that is very uncomfortable.
reviewDescription: The chair is what I was looking for when gaming. There is a bar going through the middle back of the chair that ruins it. It is uncomfortable. I'm trying to find some kind of pillow to cover up that part but didn't expect an additional purchase.
Constantly have to re-tighten the bolts. Lasted 2 months. Don't waste your money.
Missing the hardware and wrench to assemble. Would not recommend way over priced

I was really excited about this chair and it does look great. It's also incredibly uncomfortable for even the shortest amount of time. The seat has almost no padding and there's zero chance I could sit in it for a few hours at a time to work on my computer. I sent it back immediately. I bought a lumbar support pillow to use in the chair I already own and it's much betterUpdate: The return process for this chair was really strange. The company repeatedly emailed asking me to keep the chair, insisting that the shipping cost for them would be over $50 and offering a $10, then $15 credit if I didn't send it back. It was suggested multiple times that I give the chair to family or friends. It was $130 though, so of course I declined. Then I was sent a label to return it, different from the one Amazon gave me, and told the shipping would be $20, even though Amazon said it would be free. I used the Amazon label and paid nothing and received a full refund, but I wouldn't buy anything from this company again, after the tried to trick me into paying shipping so they could save money.

I am not able to mount the mechanism because the screw holes were not drilled correctly. I am a college student so I’m not sure where I will be able to get a drill to do this task myself I am very disappointed.

I should have just purchased the secret labs chair. May of been 500 more, and it would have been more comfortable and not just a poorly built racing bucket seat. Overall a meh product. The pillow that vibrates died literally today, it smells like burnt plastic. My behind doesn’t hurt yet. It is sturdy for now. It will probably degrade quickly over time. It certainly not designed for someone of my height. That being 5’5”. There is a huge gap I could fall through between the seat and the upper portion. The design is flat and the aesthetics would not even work in a race car. Honestly I got what I paid for, no amount of support or apologies could ever fix that.Buy this at your own risk.

reviewTitle: the skin of the arms are falling off!!!
reviewDescription: Hi! , i bough this chair this year on may 4th and as you see the arms are losing its cover :/ and its only been like 2-3 months , i wouldn't recommend this chair !

Recently purchased this chair for my media room and the right side arm rest screw doesn’t reach to hold the arm rest in place. I went through the hardware again to verify I had the correct one but it just spins in place. I even screwed it in without the arm rest and it works but it’s not long enough??? Despite the cool appearance and extra pillows it comes with the chair is very uncomfortable to sit in when gaming for longer than 45 minutes.

once i got the chair, i immediately noticed the color (i ordered the blue one) was way off. nothing major, but still frustrating. once i got it assembled, i noticed the seat and back were far from aligned and i could not fix it. the leg rest does not extend far enough, so it only reaches to the middle of my shins. not comfortable at all. the reclining back is either way loose and doesnt swing back, or locks in place wherever you set it. would not recommend buying it
There is not a massage feature in this chair. Has a pillow but no usb or way to make it massage…

My husband's old gaming chair was very sturdy and comforable so that is what we looked for in replacing it. Although this one is advertised as "most comforatable" it was not. His back and legs hurt as soon as he started using it. He ended up going back to his old, beat up, but comfy chair and now this one is just sitting in our dining room taking up space. Unfortunately I didn't look into the return policy. We would have to disassemble it, pack it, and ship it back at our expense. If we had bought it in a store we could just take it back. Very sorry we bought this and will definitely think twice before purchasing an item like this from  an online only store in the future.

My fiancé is a big gamer and has a similar chair. I started a new at-home office job. Did a lot of research because I needed a chair that’s comfy, lumbar support, has message and honestly cute. Dream made! Took about an hour to fully assemble alone though
Great chair. Got it for my home office. I am not a gamer. Very comfortable.

We recently bought a PC laptop for my son and this is the exact gaming chair he was looking for. He chose the colors! Very bright! Easy to install and very very sturdy! It's worth it imo! Great value!
It’s all you could ask for and more
All features are great definitely would buy again!

reviewTitle: Comfortable, Easy to assemble, All parts included!
reviewDescription: Looks just like the product images! Is comfortable and has a great design. I was able to assemble it by myself in about an hour.

reviewTitle: The quality feels good and all the installation instructions are perfect.
reviewDescription: I use this product as a gift for my boyfriend and he loved it
Very cool! Thank you!
I love this chair, is really comfortable! and I use in my Ofice not for games, but works very well.
Very practical and comfortable. Designed very well and even has an electronic massager in the back. Totally recommend it.
Butttttt! My left arm will not screw in. It seems as if the hole where the screw screws in is warped and keep coming apart.
Sturdy chair- husband put together while I was gone.  Wrong color sent
The back piece does not attach to the bottom piece straight

reviewTitle: to many steps & directions could be better
reviewDescription: I bought for my 10 yr old Son to game in. He LOVES it & also helped me put it together :) directions are ok but could be clearer, took us 2 1/2 hrs to assemble UGH!! other then that I recommend

reviewTitle: Okay for the price but it could be better
reviewDescription: I’m a big gamer boy and I game. Didn’t take a crazy amount of effort to build but I’ve tried everything I can’t get the chair to go up I tried hammering the hydraulic in so the button can press but it won’t do it, chair can go down but not up, if you use without the lumbar support it’s mad uncomfortable cuz there’s a metal bar that goes across your back with little to no padding. Dissatisfied but it is what it is. Massaging lumbar is alrigjt maybe my girlfriend would like it more than i if you catch my drift I give it 6-10

reviewTitle: NOT comfortble but there's a fix
reviewDescription: The assembly was really easy, very nice. I've had the chair now for less than a week and the seat is thin, the sides are rigid and there is a bar that goes along horizontally the mid back (inside the seat) that is just crazy uncomfortable. Absolutely NO padding in the seat back at all, OUCH. I do love the arm rests and the foot rest (and I am tall) but this chair just has no padding whatsoever (except the arm rests!). I do want to mention that I contacted the company about the bar in the chair and they were so kind as to refund me the difference for a lumbar support so I wouldn't feel it. Although I don't necessarily believe you should have to purchase extra items when getting a chair to make it comfortable, I do really appreciate the fact that they reached out to me and they were so accommodating and in fact followed up again to make sure I was comfortable after I received the cushion. It's an excellent company, just wish that bar was not an issue!

You definitely get what you pay for here. Good chair my only complaint is if your a hardcore gamer you’ll need an additional seat cushion, it comes with like a 1 in thick little foam seat it sucks. Besides that it’s straight.
Missing some washers making the arms wobbly

reviewTitle: Good starter chair! A few hang-ups
reviewDescription: This is a great "starter" chair considering the price, but I do have a couple issues with it (they are small issues overall)The instructions are a bit vague at times, such as when putting the wheels on, it simply said "install the wheels" without going into detail (I just shoved them in there). They do include an allen wrench and all the screws are in nice packaging so they don't get lost as easy, so that is a plus (they even included extra parts!).The main reason I picked this chair was the footrest, and while it does get the job done, it feels... off. It isn't strong, and dips at the slightest pressure so I'm scared of it breaking (BUT it hasn't yet, will update if it does). The rest of the chair is holding up well though! Another pint regarding the foot rest is I do NOT recommend it for taller people. I'm about 5ft 2 and half of my lower leg dangles off. If you're any taller then 5ft 5, I'd stick to buying a separate foot rest.Overall, chair is pretty good for a starter chair considering other gaming chairs are anywhere from 50-200$ more, and don't have the higher weight limit like this one doesTL;DR Instructions are vague at times, foot rest feels off, but a good chair for the price.

reviewTitle: Comfortable, but some screws didn't fit
reviewDescription: The provided screws on the back part didn't fit in the holes. I had to use spare screws from my own toolbox. If I didn't have screws that fit, I would have returned the whole thing. Once I got it together, it was  comfortable and works well.

I got this chair on sale for $110 (not counting shipping) which I recommend you do.Assembly: It took barely an hour to put together and could’ve honestly been quicker than that had I not been multitasking. It’s incredibly easy/simple to assemble, a child (of good enough strength to tighten the screws and lift the chair) could build this. Despite it’s simplistic construction is feels smooth and sturdy.Experience: initially, it felt cheap. The sides of the backing of the chair feel as though they are lined with pool noodles, which threw me off at first. I was worried the chair was going to be stiff or uncomfortable. However, I was pleasantly surprised! It’s very comfortable to sit in, and the telescoping arms and foot rest are incredibly appreciated. I will say the plastic of the arms feels on the cheaper side and they already seemed a little wobbly shortly after construction. This can likely be amended by tightening the screws. The lumbar support pillow sits a little low for me, so I wish it adjusted to an even higher point, but I will say I am rather curvy so that’s likely a me problem. The headrest pillow is very nice and the backrest reclines and locks well, doesn’t feel wobbly or like it’s going to tip backwards. The chair also sits very low which was wonderful since it fit under my bunk bed, *and* fit my legs comfortably under my desk, which is impressive since most others do not (I have thicker thighs).Summary: I think this chair is definitely one of the best on the market for the price point. It’s not exactly top of the market quality but that’s to be expected for only $110. I would expect slightly better quality if I were paying the full $200 for it, though. Recommended on sale, and especially for those on more of a budget. Exceeded expectation. 8/10

reviewTitle: Trying it now...  here's the run-down!
reviewDescription: Just assembled it. It is quite easy if you just review the parts.My first impression is, considering its bulk or size, it is like an internet date where you expect a 160 lb person but a 110 lb person shows up. So it is a bit thin in foam and size. The width is not as wide as a normal black foamy office chair. I myself may have preferred a chair with built-in pillows rather than the little ones meant to be placed on the chair, although they do stay in place.The pillows are small, and the seat has no front bump to keep you from sliding off during intensive gaming or TV-watching sessions. The lower back pillow straps around the chair like a backpack and slides up and down somewhat. It vibrates, if you're into that type of thing, but you have to be 3 feet from a USB (large end) outlet to plug it in, and it has no on/off switch or controller; it unplugs from an 80s-style charger port at the base of the seat. That unplug is in an okay spot and does not dangle all the way to the floor.The controls for up/down and reclination are not easy to reach. You have to either stick your arm through the right armrest or lean way to the right and around, but they do work well and lock in place nicely. The top pillow is okay and can be moved so you can sit back and watch TV, but it does not have the comfort level for extended TV viewing. As for gaming, I am impressed. The forward position, when locked in place, keeps you at a perfect position to rest your elbows on the armrests and hold a controller in front of you while keeping your back in a much more comfortable position than most chairs, all while resting your feet on the legs of the chair above the front two casters. You can sit Indian style in any position, and tilting back allows for wider leg expansion. The leg rest is more of an accessory. If you need to stretch out your legs and rest a while, it is okay, but it is not very wide so you need to keep your legs straight. The foam comfort level is above average. The pleather vinyl indents quickly, but it is not the shiny type, so it is not too sweaty.GTPLAYER really made a great simple chair. Great for upright gaming. Okay for standard computer use. It really should only cost $20 more than a $65 office chair, so if that is what you use, stick with that. What you're getting in addition is less but tougher foam, a separately reclining backrest with arms that pivot and move, vibration, and leg rest. Although quite a bit smaller than the picture, I am satisfied.If you type this review into ChatGPT, it will give you the pros and cons; too long to paste.I will update after 30 hours of computer use.

The chair is generally comfortable, and has the basic posture modifications. You can tilt back almost into a completely flat recline and adjust the height. This one comes with an extension for your legs like a reclining chair would have, but I was very surprised to find out that IT does not offer the option of rocking. That has always been a standard an any office or gaming chair I’ve ever owned in the past, and I was very surprised to find out this one doesn’t have it. I actually use the rocking feature regularly, so I was very disappointed to see that it’s not a feature of this chair.

Never had a chair like this and I must say, not bad...The instructions were very simple to assemble the chair with numbered tools. Since I assembled it by myself it took a little time because this thing is heavy! Especially in one of the steps...but I did it! Also, the pull out part in the front is not SO bad. I think I need to oil it or something because when I pull it out and push it back it after use, there is some resistance when there should be a smooth glide. The small backrest pillow is supposed to help support your lumbar area and you can also plug it in for a small vibration to help your back. Just don't expect it to do a great massage or something...the vibration power is only as much as my Gillette razor...oh well.

I purchased the chair that was fabric instead of the pleather version. This allows more air flow, and the overall weight of the chair is much less. My initial impression was good, but not great. The chair back had little padding so it felt like I was resting on the board contained therein, rather than the cushion. It wasn't uncomfortable; merely not as relaxing as I hoped. The overall construction was solid, and assembly was quite easy. The leg rest is a nice feature, although I wish it extended much farther out. Overall, I am pleased with my purchase; hence the 4 stars, but not quite 5 based on the previous comments.

The chair took about more then a hour to make with some help with a YouTube video and finding the instructions online. But for some reason it did NOT come with instructions. Not the best chair I’ve ever sat on but in all honestly it was okay. Not bad. Worth $100? I don’t think so in my opinion.

I recently purchased this massage pillow and have mixed feelings about it. While the overall product is great, there are a few issues that need to be addressed. The massage pillow itself is quite lackluster and barely vibrates, which is disappointing. Additionally, it causes a terrible amount of noise during use. Another issue is that the screws in the armrests back out regularly, requiring frequent retightening. Despite these drawbacks, I still find the product to be quite useful and effective overall.

I wanted to wait a week before I did my review and here are my thoughts.  For the price, this is a great chair and I'd buy it again.  I work from home 80% of the time and also play Xbox at night in the same room so I use a chair A LOT.  Previously, I had a cheap desk chair from Amazon that I got in 2020 when the world shut down and we were all working from home.  I'll just do pros and cons:Pros:1. Easy to assemble.2. VERY sturdy chair.  Metal frame and smooth wheels, height and recline adjustments are very smooth and natural3. Vibrating lumbar pillow is a plus.4. Recline is great and feels sturdy.5. Nice to have a pull out footrest.6. Very large seat cushion.  I'm a small guy and can easily sit with my foot under my leg in like a "4" very comfortably.7. Cushions on the arms are soft and great for sitting all day.8. Every function is very smooth and feels very sturdy.9. They give you some extra parts.  I was actually missing a couple washers needed for assembly and found what I needed in the "extra" parts.10. Neck/head pillow is soft and comfortable.  It's very small but definitely standard for most of these gaming chairs.Cons:1. Seat cushion is NOT very soft.  In fact, it's a little too firm in my opinion.  I found sitting for long periods of time, my butt getting kind of uncomfortable.  I'm assuming over time it will get softer but I wish it had more of a memory foam type cushion on top of the foam.  I got a cheap memory foam cushion pad for my old chair and am actually using it on this one which does help, but then that also puts your position on the chair higher.  This in turn makes the lumbar pillow lower than it really should be.2. The leg rest comes out easy for me (saw some people having issues and you need to make sure the mounts are straight when assembling, they are adjustable as you tighten).  However, the way the leg rest flips out to use makes it very easy for it not to stay where it's supposed to be.  If you rest anything on the inside part of the leg rest, it's going to want to flip into it's storage position.  If you have your legs straight this is not an issue but I found this cumbersome at times.3. It gets kinda warm.  If you're sitting with shorts on or I would imagine if you didn't have a shirt on for some reason (don't know why you wouldn't but you do you), your skin with start to stick to it a bit.  Obviously it's not like getting into a hot car in the summer, but just something to think about.3. Being a shorter guy I wish it did go just a tiny bit lower.  My desk at home is even a little higher than some "normal" desks and it doesn't fit under the desk even in it's lowest position.  I can make it fit, but it scrapes the arm cushions a bit and I could see that ripping them in time.  Certainly not a deal-breaker, but if you're used to storing this under your desk, this may be an issue for you as well.4. For the vibrating pillow, you must be connected via USB to a power source.  I'm guessing you could use some type of battery pack but there's also no on/off, once you plug in you're on until you unplug.TL;DR: Great chair for the price.  Seat cushion could be softer imo but function/style/stability is on point.  Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a gaming chair and don't want to spend a lot of money.

It's a great chair but it's not very soft. I got the fabric instead of leather. It does have great lumbar support. It moves over all surfaces with ease. Very sturdy but one of the screws wouldn't go in all the way it some how got striped and now turns with the screw. Other then that I love it

It looks great. Feels good when you sit in it and was easy to put together. The only reason why I can't give it five stars is because after about a month, the lumbar vibrating feature stopped working. I bought a separate lumbar massager, and all is good.  I would highly recommend this chair for the house or office.

reviewTitle: you get what you pay for... right?
reviewDescription: 2.5 stars at best. -- changed to 1 star as of 4/8/2022.It's been a few months (ordered on September 12th, 2021) since we've had the chairs (ordered a red and a blue).  The red one had a defective bolt in one of the arms that forced the head to strip barely half way into the chair, so we had to contact the support team.  When explaining the situation over the phone, the response was "What do you want us to do about it?".  I continued by saying I didn't want a refund, I just want a replacement arm and seat for the chair (as well as the bolt) and I will send the other conjoined parts back to them.  They didn't want the parts back but DID send the replacements.. in two separate packages that arrived 3 days apart.FINALLY! We could enjoy our chairs together.  A few days later I developed neck and back pains from the shape of the blue chair and the lumbar vibrating bag got so hot that I was afraid it was going to melt the interior and start a fire.  For a remedy I slid a pillow and pillowcase over the chair for the necessary support and have started looking for a much better and much needed replacement.Also, for a person who is 185, 6'0", this chair is surprisingly too small in height to a point where the neck cushion attachment area digs into your neck making it quite uncomfortable.  If they were on the outside edges it would not have been as bad.___Update for 4/8/2022 --  Well, the entire right arm connection to the seat is actually stripped out.  As you can see from above, I'm not a large person and I don't use it as a crutch when moving/readjusting in the chair or a lean-to arm rest.  Went to tighten it down one day as I routinely check for loose bolts and the arm was fully tightened but ridiculously loose.  Felt around the bottom of the seat and it is 100% stripped out sliding freely back and forth from the connection.  Do NOT buy these chairs.  Updated Stars from 2.5 to 1.

reviewTitle: This chair is not as plush or comfortable as you might think
reviewDescription: I would just like to say that I do my research very seriously when searching for an object I would like for a while, including when it is for a lot of money. however I would say that this chair is the most disappointing purchase I've made recently.When arrived it was fine, everything looked good. But upon opening just the tools box, I was already noticing I was missing parts (mostly washers and screws). I'll admit I was pleasantly surprised with the massaging lumbar cushion. But once it was all but together I was sitting there falling deeper and deeper into disappointment.There is no cushion in this. I am a thick lady, (220lbs) and my ass can barely sit in it comfortable. It feels like I'll just slid off, well, to make it more accurate, it feels like my ass is not even fully on it. The chair handles are poorly placed and make it difficult to lever one of them since it is nearly flush with the bottom of the chair. The massaging cushion is not a massage, more like just a medium vibration. Trying to set this chair up in a way that is comfortable was a chore and it didn't even hold that position, any amount of pressure on the arms would move the back of the chair forward.I honestly could complain further about how there is already rust on one of the parts, or how the welding isn't done correctly. I could mention the foot rest is weak and wouldn't be able to hold anything unless you were under the height of 4'.but I digress. I will probably be buying my chairs from wayfair from now on. I wouldn't buy this chair if you are looking for anything to actually sit in for long periods of time or to be comfortable. If your looking for something purely aesthetic then the chair might be for you.

Update: Had this chair for just over a month. A few screws are somehow starting to become loose. The chair also creaks and sometimes make a popping noise. I'm 5'8 and about 175lbs. Still haven't used the massager which tends to keep digging between the gap of the backing and bottom of the chair.The most important part that swayed me to make the purchase is the foot rest. I used an ottoman prior. The item was packed very well. The instruction booklet was laminated and instructions were clear. I was able to put the chair together within 30 minutes. All tools required was included. They even provide extra screws etc. The chair itself is not as comfortable as my $30 one. The footrest requires pulling the metal sliders from underneath the seat. However it requires a lot of wiggling. It doesn't slide right out. Haven't used the lumbar massager so can't really comment on that.

reviewTitle: Retail high to discount heavy just to get buyers! Extremely uncomfortable, loud and noisy mechanics
reviewDescription: The chair is not worth the retail price let alone a discounted price. I purchased this around $84 for the discounted price thinking I was getting a great deal.The problem is the chair is extremely uncomfortable. The seat cushion is rock hard and you can tell the material used is garbage. The chair itself makes a loud popping sound when you rest your back on the back of the chair and then move at all because of the terrible design of the chair. Both the back rest and seat are super thin as you can tell this product is a Retail price high and discount heavy to trick people into believing they made a good purchase. I wouldn't want this chair if it was free.

reviewTitle: After a year of owning it.
reviewDescription: This chair is sturdy but causes significant lower back and spine pain after short periods of use. After a night of schoolwork, my back was in severe pain. I tried different cushions to help, but they made little difference. The main issue seems to be the design of the chair itself. I've decided to buy a different chair because of this. If you need a chair for long-term use, I do not recommend this chair.

reviewTitle: 1 Year review: Don’t waste your money!!
reviewDescription: After 1 year of daily usage, here’s my review:-Terribly squeaky (wd-40 won’t fix)-Hardware is soft and cheap-Cushion is unbearable-No support; lumbar especially-Vibrating back cushion is nearly flat after 1yr-CHEAP materials-Vinyl material on armrests has been flaking off for the last 6mo (see pictures)All of this said, I would honestly recommend spending a little more money and getting a chair that will last longer than 1yr. If you’re in the market for a pile of garbage secretly disguised as an office chair, then look no further!
