I would give 0 stars if I could. This chair is the most uncomfortable thing you could ever sit in. I can’t even sit in it for not even an hour without immense pain and discomfort. The instructions were clear at least but the quality is not like the rest of the reviews said. This is a good chair to give to a relative if you actually hate them. Don’t waste your money.

I had high hopes for this product, but it turned out to be a major disappointment. After just 30 minutes of sitting, my back started to ache—not exactly what you expect from a product that’s supposed to be comfortable. If you’re looking for something that supports you and keeps you comfortable, this isn’t it. Save your money and look for something better. Trust me, your back will thank you!

reviewTitle: It didn't last two months This chair is a TOTAL waste of money
reviewDescription: The chair was purchased less than two months ago, and already it has broken at the base. The chair wobbles so much it is un-sitable. Oh, it still looks good, but it has no use.I only wegh 2020 #'s, I hope that I didn't overload it, I didn't see any weight limit.I urge everyone to NOT buy this chair, Amazon should stop selling it.

Material is low quality and seat hinge broke after 4 months of normal use. The chair no longer supports the upright position and is in a perpetual wobble, fully reclined state (big safety hazard btw). It's the worst chair I've bought from Amazon and despite its size is designed for children, not adults. But, they were smart enough to make sure it fails outside the return period and got past Amazon's high quality control standards, so props to their ingenuity because that's not as easy as it seems.

reviewTitle: Great quality and easy to put together
reviewDescription: This was a birthday present for my son. He loves it. I didn’t realize it came with massager. Great chair for the price!
Once I put together and started using it , I feel that it's a great purchase and I may but another one.

The chair is super comfortable, I arrive in excellent condition, plus the customer service is great; unfortunately my package was stolen from the door of the building and they took care of all the management so that my other chair arrived safely. without hesitation I recommend it

reviewTitle: So easy a caveman can do it
reviewDescription: I bought this for my husband for father's day. I put it together myself and it probably had the best instructions I've ever seen. I hate putting things together, but this was very easy to follow and it's nice and he loves it.

I use this chair in my office, its great the wheels move really nice on smooth surfaces, the massaging is definitely a gimmick but does give good lower back support, the recline and leg rest are really nice. For the price it is really awesome, it has kind of worn down in the past year but nothing crazy. Great product for price overall.
Thick leather-like material, excellent welding, easy assembly, impressive finish.
Bought this for my son, he’s obsessed. Easy to assemble, does come in a huge box.
I work from home and this is THE most comfortable chair I've found. Everything else leaves me sore by the end of the day. This is awesome. And it completely reclines which is awesome on breaks lol
Love how this chair looks and my son loves it as it was a birthday gift for him.  Definitely recommend this chair for bigger gamers

I've had it for around eight months and it has held up really well. I don't use the massage feature thing at all, but other than that, pretty good. It does hurt your butt after a couple of hours but so do most I've seen. I just got a cushion and I'm set for hours of Stardew.

Chair is low quality and I don’t believe it will last. Terrible seller. They sent the wrong color and made it my responsibility to contact the delivery service to stop the delivery. I attempted to contact the delivery service twice but they asker for the shipping party to contact them both times.

The chair’s arm rest cushions are worn out in 3 weeks. The head rest has squished in 3 weeks. The cushion is of inferior quality and does not provide enough support. Not recommended for office professionals maybe if you want to gift it to a child who does gaming.

Do you enjoy sitting on hard as a rock plywood? If so then this chair is for you. Do you like a chair back that makes you hurt? Then this chair is for you. How about armrests that are at an incredibly awkward height and totally not adjustable? This chair SUCKS!

reviewTitle: horrible chair and wouldnt let anyone sit on it
reviewDescription: 1. missing parts and no manual at all was included so i had to build it by looking at it.2. it rare for me to use it because im always working but when i do i noticed there was 0 cushion on the back... and the fact that you feel the metal stabbing me from my back.3. the "leg rest" that is included is pretty much pointless because it has no support to hold itself up. which overtime will bend the bottom seat and it doesnt extend far at all... its like it was built for a dwarf or someone with the shortest legs in the world.4.the bottom cushion of the chair where you sit is eh.overall the money you spend on this chair, i would tell you to save it and earn more to buy a far better chair because this was not worth more then 40-50$ and not was i bought it for.also i dont write almost any reviews so the fact that i forced myself to do this speaks volumes on how bad this chair is and i dont recommend getting it. bad quality over allto fix this crap i would have to buy more things just to make if somewhat comfortable

The video of this chair was not accurate. The size of the seat was thin and small The chair was not comfortable nor did it hold the up position. Very very disappointing. Not sturdy feeling at all. The value for the money was poor.
Bought this chair in February of this year and it’s falling apart! Seat is peeling, arm is about to fall off. Not even 6 months of use!

I received my chair with one of its arm rests missing a bearing which made it impossible to screw on to place, got in contact with the seller and they re-sent the piece missing... with the -SAME- defect, do not recommend this entire company.

Missing materials or wrong construction materials.The package was delivered in perfect condition, but the materials part was open and in the construction guide there were 2 stickers showing different names of screws that do not exist in the package.
The upholsterer is horrible. The whole seat is cracked and the arm rest are cracking now it's covered with duct tape things not even a year old. What a disappointment for my son. Don't buy it

reviewTitle: Only lasted a year and a half of minimal use.
reviewDescription: I purchased this chair in February of 2022. It was a cheaper chair so I knew it would not be the most comfortable. However, I did expect the chair to last longer than it did structurally.I used it for a few hours a day 4-5 days a week for about a year and a half and all of a sudden, the back of the chair is now stuck in the fully reclined position. It will go back up to a 90-degree angle but the second I lean back at all it just gives out. Seems like the mechanism that locks the backrest in place has failed. Before attributing this to some kind of user error, I am 5' 10'' and 200 lbs. and never even adjusted the chair once I got it to where I wanted it.Spend maybe 50 to 100 bucks more on something that with last longer. If I would have known this chair was going to be useless after 1.5 years that's what I would have done.
You have to tighten the screw every once in awhile and it will tip back
Great price, beautiful chair, easy to assemble and great customer support.
Comfortable chair for gaming. Was alot better then I thought it was going to be
Used as an office chair
My son likes it with an extra cushion
Chair is very good quality in my mind  pretty nice gaming Chair
only annoying thing is the screws that go into the arm rests get loose after some time and have to be re tightenedotherwise is pretty good and was easy to assemble

reviewTitle: not really for tall or long-legged people; neck and back cushions are too hard to be comfortable
reviewDescription: without the added features (leg rest, neck and lumbar cushions) this chair is great for working at the computer (6-8 hrs/day). the added features were made for a smaller person

reviewTitle: It’s a great chair for a gamer
reviewDescription: My son loves the chair - it’s comfortable.

reviewTitle: Not great but not, not great...
reviewDescription: So this chair checks all the boxes I was looking for, comfort, head support, lumbar support, height adjustments, and  recline adjustments. Setting up the chair is a breeze with the given instructions. This chair outperforms it's price point but at the cost of the padding quality . While I sit down I do feel better than most chairs, I still feel like I'm not on an amazing cushion. The asthetics are phenomenal and feel great as well. The arm rests are solid after you lock tight them after they come loose a few times. The wheels move very well on most surfaces and the lumbar support feels good. The whole chair is great but it just feels lacking. The cushion is good but not great, even tho I don't think it's off by much. I don't hurt from the chair on long gaming sessions but I don't ever feel completely relaxed either. I would suggest this chair and at this price category you will not do better. Overall 8/10.

I'm 200lb and 5'2. Mainly use this to sit to do homework or play games. Assembled this by myself. Connecting the top part of the chair to the bottom part is a .... but it would've been easier if I had someone to help me.Pros: color is cute, armrest can be used lying down on the chair, neck pillow and back pillow is comfy, back pillow can massage, footrest, chair is comfy on my butt(very important I had to buy a butt pillow for my last chair)can be improved: wish there was a royal blue or lighter blue option, the armrest can't be adjusted lower or higher( I prefer it to be a bit higher), no on/off button on the massage pillow

reviewTitle: Works good, left arm rest a little loose
reviewDescription: Product is good, the arm chair became loose and isn’t sturdy now.

reviewTitle: It does its job but I expected better quality.
reviewDescription: I bought this chair for my desk, I chose it made of fabric so that its material would be more durable, it is not very padded, it seems a little lacking in quality, its wheels are very noisy and lacking in quality, it is easy to assemble, if you have a Limited budget may be an option, if you have more budget find something more premium.

I love this chair and can only give it 4 stars because it is wobbly where the seat meets the stem. There is about an an inch of play rocking left to right at the armrests. I'm thinking of finding a shim of some sort to go into the base of the chair so it is a bit more solid. Other than that I have no complaints.
Could make the leg support not as wonky
Seat is harder than expected for gaming chair.

I should put a disclaimer first and foremost that I'm not a gamer. I'm a writer.... which means I do spend long periods of time seated in front of a screen. My last chair has been falling apart. That's beside the fact that it was generally uncomfortable and awkward to sit in. I've had my eyes on this chair for weeks. I've added and removed and re-added it to my shopping cart, lol. Read reviews, watched videos, checked out the Q&A section, etc. Finally, I decided to bite the bullet....so far, I'm pleased!Is the chair the most comfortable chair I've ever sat in? No. It's not even the most comfortable office/gaming chair I've sat in. BUT, for the price, I think it's a good deal. It's comfortable enough that I can see myself sitting in it for hours with no issues. It feels sturdy and the overall quality seems great for the price (though, obviously, time will tell).It was pretty easy to put together. I put it together in under an hour. I should mention that I'm not at all good with building furniture. Yes, even office chairs, lol. It's just not my thing. I've been known to give up after a frustrated rant riddled with one too many profanities. But building this chair was a pretty easy task. I still struggled with piecing together the back and seat portions of the chair (difficult when doing solo), but it was only for a couple minutes. I will say I don't have the foot rest attached, because I couldn't get mine to do so correctly, lol. This isn't a dealbreaker for me, though, as I was pretty indifferent about that feature.Overall, I'd give this 4 out of 5 stars. I took off a star for the footrest mishap. Everything is pretty good. I even like the shade of pink, which I was also worried about when ordering online. I would recommend!
This chair was easy to assemble, looks nice, but the downside is the cushion it feels like you are sitting on cardboard, I had to purchase an additional cushion elsewhere just to be comfortable.
Chair has tendency to squik when adjusting it or moving when sitting on it.

reviewTitle: the part of this where I’m holding, it had it on the wrong side

reviewDescription: Im delighted how comfortable the chair is. I love the extra functions for the massage and leg rest is nice. I dont spend several hours all at once but it does hold up and I dont have pain after sitting down couple hours at a time. The pillow rest is nice and the wheels glide smooth.
Does not lower as far as I would like it to.  Easy to roll while sitting in it.  Very easy to get out of this chair.  I wish it came in other colors.  Most important, it is QUIET!
For $100 it’s a comfortable chair that offers a lot but I have to tighten armrest once a week.

Have used the chair for a day now after building it, and I am pleased with the overall function especially for the price. It’s is not the best chair in the world, but it is a very good chair and a comfortable one. It reclines far enough to take a nap in with the foot rest, and a vibrating pillow on your lower back. The pillow on top for your neck is tops off making this chair very comfortable.I would highly recommend this chair if you need an above average office chair that’s not going to break your bank. for the price it’s excellent. Building it was easy too and not long, 45-1 hr and it a a short hour. Easy instructions as well.I will say if you are a heavier person I feel like this chair won’t support you as well, at least the foot rest . It says 250lb limit and beileive it’s because of the foot rest as it’s not held in the trails at multiple points, just one screw. Keeps it from sliding forward. Luckily Im I on The lighter side so the foot rest has been my favorite part

It shipped super fast and sturdy for its price. i bought this because my last gaming chair broke and i needed something else at a cheap price. my main concern is sturdiness of the chair which in my opinion is pretty strong. i personally dont care too much about the extra features but they are pretty nice, the foot rest is nice although the leaning feature is my personal favorite. i dont like the massager but honestly didnt even know it had one until put it together. the chair isnt the the most comfortable but it will do
Really good chair just what I needed at my desk
Chair arm came bent so couldn’t get the last step to work. Ultimately it took three grown men to lean on the arm to get the screw in to hold it. Upside is it’s a strong chair.

This was one of my boyfriend’s Christmas gifts, and he loves it! It’s super comfortable, easy to assemble, and very easy to clean. The massage feature is a plus but doesn’t get used very often, it’s more of a light vibration for the back, but the rest of the chair is super nice!

reviewTitle: Comfortable but flaw with foot rest
reviewDescription: The chair was easy to assemble and is fairly comfortable, but does have a flaw with the footrest. When using the footrest in the upright position it tilts the seat forwards making it uncomfortable. There is no screws mounted to the bottom seat preventing the tilt from occuring.

Good budget gaming chair- not hard to put together (i.e. instructions are good). The color is different than what was pictured. The bottom cushion is a little firm if you are looking for something softer for longer periods. The recline and lumbar pillow are really good. It's not hard to recline like other chairs I've had. I have back problems and the lumbar pillow is perfectly shaped and positioned (others I've had just don't hit right). The head pillow that it came with did not come with any strap so it's not even usable. The band going across in the picture is the zipper, not a strap. I'm contacting the seller so I'll update if they fix this issue to let you know how customer service handles this. The footrest wobbles when pulling it out and does not slide easily, but it works fine and is comfortable to use once pulled out. I rarely use footrests anyway, but it's a nice addition for the price. Gliding on surfaces and turning is smooth. Overall it's a good gaming chair for the price.Edit: Customer service sent a new pillow with the correct strap without any issues.
This chair is very uncomfortable. Will hurt your tailbone and back after an hour or so.The foot rest is a very cheap design and bends when you put your feet on it.Overall..... go with another chair.

I was at staples and was looking for a comfortable chair and found non till I sat in the Gaming chair  "Staples Emerge"  Wow the comfort was wonderful.  It was expensive so I went on line at Amazon and decided on GTPlayer a less expensive  chair.  You get what you pay for.  I should have considered you do not have to pay for shipping and got the right chair.  Even Amazon had the Staples chair but avoid shipping and get at the store.

reviewTitle: I little hard but is okay
reviewDescription: Is okay

First thing first.I ordered this chair through Amazon, and the notice I received it will arrive between Jun 4-9May 29th, I was out working all day, I came home around 1 am, and the big box was sitting outside.Luckily I live in a very safe condo, and no one steals it.I never receive any notification this item arrived.This chair I always wanted, I sat on it at Office Depot and is very comfortable.I put this together within 15 minutes, but I still have a lot of screws left, one part that is missing, is the bottom base part, but is not a big deal, I can still put it together without it.I sat on it after, the seat is hard, this is not the same as the one I sat on at the Office Depot.Once again, this is not a deal-breaker, I do like it, and I also like it because this chair is not huge like some of the office chairs, I really like the size, and also like the pillow for my neck and my back.The leg extender is not great, is not as relaxing as some of these reviews said it is.I giving this 3 stars
The vibrating back part is just E waste. Other than that is it all around okay. The bottom does not have the amount of cushion it could.

reviewTitle: Not enough foam padding in the butt area
reviewDescription: This chair is decent if you are looking for a gaming chair specifically, the car came in a fairly sized box and assembly was fairly straight forward too. My biggest complaint is that it can be too narrow for larger sized people. I am 260 pounds at 5 ft. 8 in. with a semi larger upper body and lower body and I struggle to find enough room for my thighs. Assembly was easy came with all the screws it needed, a Philips head/ hex key tool was provided, didn't need anything else tool wise to assemble it. My biggest complaint is that there is not enough padding in the chair to stay comfortable. The lumbar pillow they include with the chair just becomes flat after a few minutes of use, not really useful at all but that could be due to my weight. The head rest pillow seems decent enough, hasn't gone flat but I'm sure that's because not a lot of weight gets applied to it.

To begin with, the chair was a little dirty straight outta the package, just odd for a brand new item. My husband was a little frustrated building it because some of the pieces on the instructions were incorrectly named. The size of the chair fit perfectly in the limited space we have,and is pretty cool looking, this is my sons first gaming chair and he's in love with it. Pretty good quality for the price

I bought 2 chairs 6 weeks ago and they were delivered quickly. We assembled one and it’s a nice chair. I like the footrest. However the other chair had no wheels in the box so we couldn’t assemble. I reported to seller who told me they would send a whole new base. Here we are 6 weeks later and haven’t received anything. So our 2nd chair is still sitting in the box.
Hardly any padding on the seat section makes long gamings not worth it.

reviewTitle: It's Average, but not what I expected
reviewDescription: The chair itself is made with good quality fabric - It feels like leather. It doesn't feel cheap. However, It's a little faulty. When I was setting up the chair, I realized that I received a pre-opened or returned item. The tool kit was taped closed, showing that it had been used before. Additionally, some of the pieces were not properly made to fit their designated location. Finally, the foot rest is very tight and hard to pull out. It requires a great deal of physical effort to get it out. This is pretty disappointing, considering that was the reason I decided to go with that chair. It's not the most comfortable. It's better than one of the cheaper options, but it's not ideal for me, as I sit for at least 8 hours per day.

The chair works. And that's its best feature.Is it comfortable? I mean it doesn't actively harm me and not all chairs have been able to make that claim. But no, no matter how I align it or myself to it, I am never comfortable in this chair. That was clear almost immediately after building it and remains true after one could argue it was broken in. It holds my weight (230 lbs) and moves as it should. A perfectly capable seat for visitors you don't want sticking around too long.There is nothing wrong with this chair. There just isn't much good about it either. And at roughly $100 when I bought it, I definitely should have gone with a different option. Odds are good I'd at least end up with the same result.
Leaning back, it wants to fall backwards too easy. Can bust your head on table behind you. Arms get in the way, we left ours off.

I never thought this chair will not last a year. The arm rest’s ‘leather’ is already peeling off. Poor material. I regret buying this chair. Do not be deceived by the reviews. Most people didn’t review it after months usage. This chair won’t last a year.

I read every single review and thought I was getting a good deal with the amount of great reviews raving about it. Guess I’m in the minority here but the chair feels incredibly cheap. It’s uncomfortable to sit in for more than an hour and leaves my tailbone sore. The back pad is almost nonexistent, it’s super thin and I can feel the frame on my back. Some chairs have a little bit of a resistance when you leave the recline unlocked to allow you to kinda lean back and forth — this chair does not. Once you have unlocked the recline function it’s either all or nothing meaning you’ll go straight back if you lean back a little. Honestly wish I would've bought something higher quality. I think if i buy an additional cushion it'll be salvageable. I do like the foot rest though. I'm lean and 5'10" so I'm not overly large by any means.if you're on a budget and need a chair, go for it. if you want something higher quality and more comfortable, look elsewhere
Vibration on chair stopped work after 1 week....😡

There're no ergonomics to this chair at all! The seat is flat and hard and leans slightly forward; the foot rest might as well be welded in the tucked position - sliding it in and out is very hard (the rails keep binding up); the lumbar support has a USB cable to power the vibrate feature - where the heck am I supposed to plug that in there I don't trip over it every time I get out of the chair, where it doesn't get tangled around the chair's casters every time I roll it in or out of the desk, or getting all wound around the legs of my chair any time I pivot, never mind getting all tangled up with all the other cables I have under my desk.Don't buy this chair!
The wheels don’t stay on very long

reviewTitle: What you’d expect for the price
reviewDescription: For the price I wasn’t expecting the comfiest chair, but there is almost no comfort in the back rest. Also the arm rest are already falling apart and I’ve only had it for 2 weeks
Mala cálida

reviewTitle: To many things just not done well.
reviewDescription: When I was looking for a chair I chose this one because it had a foot rest. In my mind this was something my old one didn’t have and I saw it as a small upgrade. When the chair got here I put it together and instantly realized I had gotten a cheap chair. The foot rest barely comes past my knees and feels so flimsy I will never use it in fear of it breaking off. It has a vibrator in the lumbar support pad that is so poorly made I had to take it apart and mess with it to get it to work after only a few days of use. The chair also barely reclines at all. To sum up, the chair is decent material, and feels sturdy but all the added features are very poorly done. I wish I had went with a different product.

Great chair for gaming I've had it for a couple weeks and its got 80hrs on it now, my only issue(s) with it are the arms keep coming lose and become wiggly. They haven't fallen off or anything and still hold my arms but the wiggle is strange. The only other thing is the leg rest, it works great and is solid but for someone 6ft tall it’s a little short so it’s awkward to use. It was a little stiff at first when it came to comfort but it has relaxed a bit and has started becoming more comfortable. If it wasn't for the wiggle arms I would of gave it 5 stars.
Is a very easy and sturdy chair to get together.
I use this product for WAH, after 8 hours of use, it can be uncomfortable due to lack of padding & the footstool is a little uncomfortable as well. But it serves its purpose.

I have been using this chair for about 3 weeks. I don't sit much but for the days that I do, this feels great.  I have used the reclining feature a few times. I work 7 days a week and this helps when I can get a break.

While I did have to reach out more than once (probably a problem with Amazon’s messaging system), this seller replaced a defective piece and remained in contact through delivery. My son loves this chair!

reviewTitle: Comfortable but Massager broke within a couple months
reviewDescription: It is a great chair, but the lumbar pillow doesn't have a long lifespan.
I wish the arms were a little stronger but over all it's a nice chair
It's a good chair overall, and very comfortable.  However, my left armrest is already ripping after 6 months, and that's my non-mouse arm so I use it less.

I would have give five but I can’t move my chair around the room because I’m stuck to a plug 🔌 the chair is comfortable ,great material ,supportive ,recline capability overall perfect and if you have a lot of, butt you need to get this chair
Decent Chair for the price.

I work from home and bought this chair the end of December so I've have it not even 6 months and it just broke around the weld where the hydraulic rod connects to the chair. Very disappointed especially since this wasn't supposed to be a cheap chair. The chair itself was comfortable just mad it didn't hold up for very long.
Beautiful chair… well it would be if it came with the entire assembly the whole lower half is missing

reviewTitle: Not Worth the Price or Hassle
reviewDescription: It took me a while to consider doing this review, but I ended up having to purchase another chair from a  different company due to this experience.Cons - The attached pic are just some of the damages on the chair (s) I received. I had to have a replacement chair sent because the first one I had received had missing hardware, was dirty, not symmetrical, the armrest didn't line up to the chair, and there was hair in the wheels which led me to purchasing replacement wheels. Overall there was a lot wrong. Only for me to have another chair sent where, it was dirty as well, the armrest and the back of the chair didn't even line up with the base and was crooked. There was still so much wrong with the chair. After talking with their customer service they stated that the problems were due to how their warehouses had them stored and only offered a $15 refund. Which was an added insult being that I was out of pocket $139.99.Pros - Chair design was nice and fit my room design (which is why I ordered it to begin with), Shipping was fast, response from customer service was quick.

reviewTitle: Your money is better spent elsewhere.
reviewDescription: Let me get the actual product's review out of the way first: It's adequate, but for a few dollars more you can go into your local office supply store and walk out with a substantially better chair with less of a hassle to set up. But, if you can't afford that and want something that's good enough, this chair is just that.The real reason this gets a 1 star review from me is due to the impossibility of returning this chair. I assembled the thing, didn't like it, and sent in a return request. Went in to the place I was told to drop it off at, they told me it wouldn't be possible to ship it back without essentially paying the cost of my return in the first place. I could conceivably deconstruct some of the thing, but I lack the tools and the time to properly take this chair apart.Again, it's fine for what it is, but if you're on the fence about buying a chair from amazon, absolutely don't do it. You will be married to this thing.

This chair is terrible. It didn't even last a year before losing its shape everywhere. My son, who is only about 90 pounds, used it, so it's not a case of excessive weight. The quality is just poor. Save your money and don't buy it!
Was not hard to out together the only thing is its really cheaply made and very thin.

If you never had a gaming chair, this will be an ok chair. However, if you are used to comfort sitting for hours on your desk, avoid this chair. Not comfortable at all. Very disappointed. Bad bad worse product I have ever had from Amazon.

reviewTitle: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS CHAIR TERRIBLE PRODUCT HORRIBLE COMPANY
reviewDescription: Do not purchase this gaming chair. It is of terrible quality. It broke within two weeks of receiving it. The company makes you jump through hoops to get anything done. You will deal with multiple emails you will deal with multiple people and they’re horrible customer service they make you send videos, photographs, they admitted that the arms breaking on the chair has happened to many customers -they said they had engineers looking into it. Ok sure. supposedly it’s covered under a one-year warranty but that’s a joke they don’t follow through with that. I filed a claim with Amazon and the only response I got with this company was emails asking me to drop the file against them. Amazon should no longer allow them to sell on their site. Be warned it’s a cheap product. It will break. It will be a nightmare dealing with them. They don’t follow through with what they promise. Beware of third-party sellers especially this one. Definitely look elsewhere.

Chair is ok but I wouldn't call it super comfortable. There's not much padding in the seat so after sitting in it for a few hours, or even as little as an hour, my butt starts to hurt and have to constantly adjust. Assembly was pretty simple and is sturdy so that's a plus. Honestly I didn't expect much for the price point and if I could do it again I would just spend more money on a different chair.Updated review: unfortunately I had to drop my score all the way to a 1. This chair is so uncomfortable it makes my butt and back hurt even sitting in it for a few minutes. It feels like I am sitting on a hard piece of wood with a comically thin piece of pleather on it. I hate this chair, if I knew it was going to be this bad I would never have bought it. I actually hate going on my computer because of this chair. Do yourself and your body a favor and buy something else. Spend the money elsewhere and don't suffer. Definitely going to find a better chair now.
This didn’t even last me 4 months and I barely use it.

reviewTitle: Super cute, but wider hips beware!
reviewDescription: VERY CUTE! However, with wider hips the chair was a bit snug and lacked padding in the seat (my booty hurt after about 2 hours and I work an office job). Other than that, it's super nice and adjustable for height and changing the angle of the back. I'd recommend getting a seat cushion to go with it

It feels pretty durable. Be careful to lean all the way back as it's prone to tipping over. The leg rest goes about halfway down my legs so its there somewhat. I would not even bother with the leg rest. Pretty easy to assemble.

I am 5”11 and 165 pounds. This chair is very very sturdy, but that takes a few points off of how comfortable it is. Fake leather tends to stick to your skin. It’s a great chair for the value with comfort that can keep me comfortable for hours upon hours of gaming, but my brother got one of the more expensive ones that has a memory foam cushion. Probably would’ve bought that if I did this over again.

The chair itself was great but the assembly instructions were terrible. I was afraid to sit in it after putting it together, but I've used it for about a week. My main concern long-term is that the back massager doesn't have a switch (you have to unplug it to turn it off). But other than that it's pretty comfy.

Assembled very easily, came with everything that was needed and even came with a little Allen wrench and the instruction book was very easy to follow. Thoroughly impressed with how this chair looks and feels. I like the lean back feature with the foot rest.

reviewTitle: Easy to put together, sturdy and comfortable
reviewDescription: My husband loves it, but I think it could be slightly more comfortable. The faux leather seat makes it somewhat harder than a cloth cushion would be; that's the only reason I gave it a four instead of five. The stainless steel parts hopefully will keep it from easily breaking.

reviewTitle: Not bad but a bit firm
reviewDescription: I like the chair but it is all or nothing when it comes to reclining.  The seat is a bit stiff or firm but still comfortable. You can easily take a nap in this thing though.  I just wish that it had a medium reclining option.  All that said, I'd buy again if needed.

I had some problems during assembly. Good customer service. They helped me resolve the issue when assembling and even offered to send replacement parts. The chair is comfortable even though it seems to lack padding.
Just what my son wanted

reviewTitle: It was delivered and time price excellent
reviewDescription: I bought it as a gift for my son for his computer and gaming table. He loved it perfect
Mine never came with an instruction manual. So that was fun having to google the instructions...

I think it was easy to assemble, the lower lumbar support (can vibrate) and head support are nice! The only issue is the foam padding for the armrest its not terrible by any stretch of the imagination but I can feel my elbows on the plastic underneath the padding sometimes and I'm not even pressing in hard or sitting at an extreme angle. I paid under $200 for this and would recommend to others!

The size is perfect, it’s very sturdy and the purple is much deeper than in the pictures which is exactly what I was hoping for. The only complaint I have is the lumbar support cushion “massage” is merely a pillow that vibrates alittle. Could be better but honestly who cares? It’s a great chair that assembled pretty easily and offers great support and mobility.

UPDATE A YEAR N A HALF LATER:DONT GET THIS CHAIR!! i’m 5’6” and 160lbs. i used this chair daily, for at least 12 hours a day, since i got it. after barely a year and a half this chair has completely broken apart. first, the left arm of the chair came off from where it was screwed in, with no way of getting it back in. due to this there was a harmful metal connection protruding from the side of the chair. a few months after that happened, while sitting in it, the chair’s base completely snapped off the piston so that the chair freely moved backwards, forwards, and sideways with no stability.THIS DESIGN AND THE QUALITY ARE NOT WORTH IT! FOR $200 WITH SHIPPING YOU CAN GET SOMETHING BETTER!edit: contacted customer support and they replaced the massager pillow for me! now my main gripe is the wheels. they do NOT wheel around well at all. i went ahead and got replacement wheels from amazon, replaced them, and the chair rolls around infinitely better.for the price, i really love the chair and what it’s done for me already. i love everything about it. the footrest, the armrests, the pillows for extra back support, and the massager. the recline and lift are great. most of all, I LOVE THE COLOR!assembly was easy and the instruction manual it came with was good. came with everything you need to assemble and it didn’t take me long, less than an hour.my ONLY 2 complaints about this product are:the armrests are not even. 1 is lower than the other by maybe a centimeter, not extremely noticeable but you do notice it if you’re just sitting with your arms on the rests. i think this is because of where the holes in the back of the chair were drilled for them to screw into. i don’t really mind this though because it was important to me to have armrests that connect to the chair itself and i don’t notice the difference when i’m gaming.2 is that the massager, which was by far my MOST FAVORITE part of the chair, has already gone dead apparently. it no longer works when plugged into my console or when plugged into a wall outlet. extremely disappointed about that since i also specifically got this chair for the massager option. hopefully will be able to get this replaced.not as big of a thing, but as shown in the pic, the pulley for the zipper was also missing for the pillow that came with the massager.

The color is vivid, the assembly was easy to read and follow. Comes with extra screws and tool. The back massager comes in handy. I work from home and sit in this chair for 8÷hours a day! Very comfortable
Got christmas 5 months ago,sturdy, used several hours a day material  is wearing away , thinning  will need to replace soon getting holes

Chair was easy to set up and looks great. Tilt back and leg rest work.No smudges or clear defects, all parts were clearly labeled.Only complaint would be the lack of cushioning in the chair besides the lumbar support. But that is a personal preference.
Every part of the gaming chair is great. The only dislike is the cushion. I wish they added a thicker cushion. But other than that, amazing chair for the price. 👍

I like the chair and it seems well built. I have only had it about a week so time will tell. I use this chair in my home office which doubles as my gaming room. I had a big comfortable office chair that this is replacing. I will say this gaming chair is not as comfortable as my office chair. It doesn't rock back, but the back is adjustable and the lumbar massage pillow is nice, but there is no control for it. It's on or off and always on full vibration. I am 6' tall and 200lb and I think if I was any bigger this chair wouldn't work for me. I think a little more padding in the seat would be a nice upgrade. Like I said time will tell do I will update this review after I have used it for some time.

Very easy to assemble, all hardware was included.  It's not the most comfortable but from the reviews I figured I'd end up getting some extra cushions for it.  Lowered all the way, my feet are flat on the floor (I'm 5'6").  The levers for the recline and height are a bit further in than I'd like but it's not a huge deal.  It's a bit annoying to get the head and lumbar pillow adjusted to the right height and to stay put but again, I figured I'd getting new cushions anyway.  The foot rest is cool but it's more of a calf rest, I'm not sure how functional it would work for someone taller.  The back of the chair is a lot thinner than I thought it would be, hoping it holds up over time.  For the price it's a good deal, I just wouldn't expect anything phenomenal.

Amazon wouldn’t accept my photo but the chair does the basics of nothing else. Not hard to put together. The massage pillow just vibrates. Nothing too special. The foot rest is a pain to pull out. I don’t really use it. Chair swivels, it leans back, and it can be lowered or raised.it does its job.
I can feel the screws in the foot rest so I might have an extra pillow for it soon. But I love it.

reviewTitle: Best chair for money, little finicky
reviewDescription: It’ll grow on you: for the money it’s great.

Price was right, so I ordered it.  For $100-ish not sure how this will hold up as the user is 6ft 2" and 200lbs.  If he gets a year out of it...then great, its paid for itself.  Very easy to assemble, looks cool, and has some nice features, for example the head rest and pop out leg rest.  Just hope it holds up as now and then it needs tightening up here and there.
Its a very nice chair honestly I wont be using the massage setting as it just vibrates. I do love the extension part for your legs but the chair needs to be broken in a little to get more comfortable

reviewTitle: Love it but feel like the seat is a little too firm and the foot rest is kind of useless
reviewDescription: I really like it, the material seems good quality and it comes with 2 small pillows (one of them is vibrating) but the chair seems a smudge too firm for me. Its ok when its inclined but it would probably be uncomfortable sitting strait up for long periods of time...I like the idea of the footrest, but it seems useless to me (not long enough to hold your legs comfortably, or put your feet on, unless you tuck them maybe)...I like the different color options, really wanted the white and pink but went for black and purple for cleaning purposes (but the material seems pretty easy to clean)Assembly was ok, lots of pieces but not that terrible.
Comfortable.  Don't buy it for the recliner aspect.

This chair would have been easier to put together if the screws would have been in easier packaging to open. The pictures are super small and once you get the screws out of the package it is hard to figure out which ones to use. Otherwise the chair was easy to assemble. It just took longer because of the packaging.

reviewTitle: Better support would make this a better chair
reviewDescription: This is how I would improve the overall quality of this chair.1. provide more robust lower back support2. provide a better seat cushion that's not so hard3. I prefer a straight padded arm rest vs. a curved one. Provides better wrist support.4. Lengthen paddle arms for chair height / back adjustments

reviewTitle: Price fits the quality, it's not bad.
reviewDescription: Not bad, quality fits the price, easy to assemble. The lumbar massage pillow is a simple vibration, nothing fancy but it does feel good after doing some deadlifts or fight sports. Took me about 40min to assemble myself. The fabric option would probably be easier to maintain, because the fuax leather gets marked easier with sweat, its easy to clean, but I'll probably have to do it often.
The chair is very easy to build and comfortable
Easy to put together , comfy, and great price.
This chair has everything I need, my only problem is that it takes around 2-4 hours if you have no experience in building to set it up. Other than that it's amazing love it!
The seat sits forwards and the foot rest is basically a waste of time. You get what you pay for sometimes

Have a lot of friends with secret labs chairs that told me not to buy this and it’s terrible. Personally I think it’s fine. I’d it a lazy boy no. But for the price I can sit and game in it for 5 hours and I’m fine.

Great product but after paying $29 for shipping I expected to at least have my box inside the building and it was left outside the building not even in the mailbox room. Risking it to get lost or stolen.
For a $100 gaming desk chair, I can’t complain. It’s cheap materials but that’s why it’s an affordable chair. Took me almost an hour to put together by myself. This will do!

I was in need if a new chair for a while now, it was easy to assemble and is comfortable up to a point, the massage mechanism stopped working after 1 week,  the wires came unattached, really like the leg rest
liked it

The chair is comfortable for the price and would highly recommend it for anyone on a budget. Fairly simple to assemble READ THE INSTRUCTIONS pay especially close attention to the armrest assembly because you can strip the nut inserted and compromise the integrity of them causing them to be weak and flimsy if assembled incorrectly.  The cons however; I'm 6'1" and it feels like my body never quite lines up in the chair, either my legs hang to far off the built in foot rest and my head fits on the back of the seat or my legs are comfortable and my head will lack support. The massage feature is just a subpar vibration mechanism but does work decently.

reviewTitle: arm rests use thin, easily bent/broken metal
reviewDescription: The metal used for the arm rests on this chair is weak. It bends outward easily, and also breaks easily.

reviewTitle: Buyer Beware: You get what you pay for (a cheap Chinese chair)
reviewDescription: One year later, this chair is falling apart. I keep having to tighten it's screws. It creaks and wobbles no matter what I do. The back will barely stay upright, I had to seriously manhandle the tensioner to be able to sit something resembling upright.The faux leather is peeled off the armrests and the seat is peeling. Foam in the seat is completely worn out (and I'm under-average weight and size). Back cushion is at 50%. These deflated long ago.The massager is an obvious joke. It just vibrates.When you prop your feet up, the chair rotates.I greatly regret buying this and not saving up for a better chair.I can only imagine many of these reviews are illegitimate in some way, this chair is absolutely awful even after just a month of owning it. Unless you just need a chair for 3 months, stay away. It's cheap, really cheap. Just don't do this to yourself, I have to haul this to the dump now.

The arms on this chair keep coming loose , i am constantly tightening them and within a couple days they are starting to loosen up again.  I personally do not find the chair comfortable , there is a gap between the seat and the back that i need to fill with a pillow to be able to use the chair for any length of time. Will be returning.

This chair would be great but the arms keep loosening. The chair was assembled on Dec. 25 and we have had to tighten the arms SIX times since then (it’s Jan 12). This seems to be a design flaw or maybe we received a faulty product. This was a gift for my son so imagine how disappointed he is with his faulty Christmas present.

I purchased this chair a little less than a year ago for my teen age son. This chair gets a lot of use as he’s a gamer and spends a lot of time on line for school. He loves the comfort of the chair, but was disappointed to see the artificial leather start peeling. His previous chair lasted almost 5 yrs with no peeling issues. I called the company and left a detailed voice mail as instructed, but never received a call back.
I give it a four star for build quality, but two stars because there’s absolutely no padding in the chair back. There is a bar in the center of my back, not comfortable at all.

The leather started peeling the very next day after installation was done...the manual addressed that the chair armrest will become loose after a period of use..I've been re-tightening the screws 5 minutes after using it. the screws are having a hard time tightening.. me being a technician always find a way to modify things to get them working properly but I must say I wish I spent the extra 40 bucks to get a different brand..I must say i do like the color and the way it feels otherwise.
Leg rest is to short, the massage cushion just vibrates but it is fairly comfortable

The seat is rather small for a gaming chair for a normal sized adult. The lumbar support moves around a lot when in use and no matter the position, always feels like it's pushing you too far forward in the chair. At least it was mostly easy to assemble but the end didn't exactly justify the means. I would try to return but these things are so big it's hard to disassemble and put back in the box and then deal with further shipping issues.

Came in with all the parts sealed or in plastic but looked off color at the seams and was stained as if had been used or left outside. Foot rest is chincy as well as the pillows. Directions helped put together pretty well. Poor quality for the chair upholstery is biggest complaint.
Perfect chair for sitting at the desk.  Firm settings for sitting back without it coming loose.  Great buy !

This chair has held up well for 7 months. The foot rest is great but could be sturdier. The pricing is on the mark. I'd recommend this to some one who doesn't want to spend much. The higher end gamer chairs go for $300+. This one is affordable for a budget gamer or a young kid starting out.
Easy to put together, stylish & durable..  ordered the red back in 2020 . Back for another in 2024 the old one is still good condition
Very sturdy and strong. I like this chair for gaming, the cushins are adjustable and so is the seat. Its pretty straight forward but a good chair.

reviewTitle: Great chair for a great price
reviewDescription: I had been looking for a gaming chair for my son. I had put some chairs on my cart and he discarded all of them and found this one.  I am glad I let him choose his own chair because he knew best the features he needed, such as adjustable height, lumbar support, massager.  The chair looks stylish as well. He has used the chair for a couple of months and it looks great. Easy to clean too!
Easy to assemble. Great quality and adjustable chair.
Easy to put together and the massage is awesome!
I bought this chair for my son as a birthday gift. He says that out of all the gaming chairs he has had this is the best chair by far. Very comfortable.
I brought for my grandson for his game station and he said it’s very good and comfortable to seat either play games or do homework
The chair is great for it's price. I got it on sale, so even more so. The build quality is quite good, and the features in the chair are also great.
Seatback comes loose so it needs to be tightened often.

This has been a great chair for my son for gaming. The color is spot on from what was shown online, the lumbar support is nice and it was fairly easy to assemble.I am not certain of the overall sturdiness or durability as it seems kind of loose and rickety after a few weeks of use, even after tightening all areas.

So far pretty nice! I originally got this one because of the footrest, but my legs are too long and it’s pretty short so I don’t use it much. I like the back and head pillows, but the massager on the back pillow is a bit useless. Also, it was pretty straightforward to put together.

reviewTitle: Great Chair! I have a few problems with it though.
reviewDescription: Beginning look for the chair. Took me about 2 hours to assemble. Much easier with someone else to help you. it’s a sturdy chair but it doesn’t automatically recline, you have to manually set it. my other problem is the leg rest is too short. i do have lengthy legs so that applies to certain people. After using this chair. i give it a 9/10. i would buy it again if it broke.

This chair is extremely versatile. It fits any comfort zone, whether you like to sit up pretty much straight or slouch, heck, even if you want to recline. The built-in massager makes life amazing when you have to sit for long periods. Overall, I highly recommend it for gamers or even just as an at-home office chair. Beware of the build process, though.

I was in need of a new gaming chair and when I saw this on sale for a hundred bones, I jumped on it. Spending only a hundred dollars on a gaming chair, I wasn't expecting too much.  But so far, I'm pleasantly surprised. It is a little smaller compared to my old chair, but that doesn't mean much to me being 5'10"  around 160 lbs. The leg rest and massage pillow are nice additions. Yeah, the pillow just vibrates, and it is sort of loud, but it's better than not having one at all. Overall, I'm happy with the money I spent
Fue un regalo para mi novio y le gustó, solo me dijo que el masajeador no es tan bueno
Ran into a snag during assembly but located extract parts that were a different size that were included

A very comfortable chair to sit in over long periods of work or browsing. I wish the material were leather. That would make it more breathable. Very easy to assemble and sturdy. It is a great chair for the price.
It's easy to install and great design. However, it does hurt my bottom after around 4 hours and my back doesn't get as much support from it.
I bought this when it was on sale for $100. My son put it together himself and loves his gaming chair . Nice head rest , useless foot rest .
We got this for my grandson and he lives it.  Very comfortable

Very happy with this purchase. First off it is actually comfortable. I'm 5'8" and 235 lbs and it fits almost perfectly. If the armrests were just maybe an inch further apart in width would be perfect but that really is nitpicking. Headrest is nice and soft, can be moved up and down or taken off completely. Really like the fact that the lumbar support is also removable. I don't use it often but is nice to have the option. Gas lift works perfect. Reclining is easy and can be locked into place which is great. Footrest slides in and out easily and when using is very nice. As far as assembling goes it took me about 45 minutes and was very easy. Instructions were very well done and easy to follow and all the hardware was included with extra parts just in case. If you are looking for a very nice chair for gaming, office, or just a great option that's comfortable and doesn't take up much space and is super easy to move around I would highly recommend this. Lastly, IMO can't be beat for the price. Would definitely buy again. No complaints.
GREAT CHAIR. VERY STURDY AND SOLID.
Only thing I would say bad is the reclining lever is a little to far down to reach easily. But other than that it's a very sturdy and comfortable chair
Great chair no problems I would recommend

Best chair EVER! BACK SUPPORT IS PERFECT. IT IS A SAFE AND SOLID CHAIR! I am so pleased with my purchase. I got it on Prime Day so the price was great. I love how it adjusts and the color and style fits perfectly in my space.
Really satisfied and happy with it

reviewTitle: Really comfortable, one of the greatest purchases ever
reviewDescription: Chair looked really promising and it did hold up, it is amazingly comfortable, practical 10/10

I replaced my old office chair for this chair since I have been doing a lot of sitting on my butt. I like the recliner and the foot rest. I'm the person that likes to cross my legs and the foot rest makes it easier for me to do that. I have noticed the arms are a bit wobbly, but other than that, it has been a great chair!
